instruction: What does the Ayah "Say: "Allah rescues you from these (dangers) and from all distress, and yet you commit Shirk" mean?
output: This Ayah means that Allah saves His servants from harm and distress, but they still associate others as partners with Him in times of comfort.

instruction: What does the Hadith "I asked my Lord not to cover us with confusion in party strife, but He refused" mean?
output: This Hadith means that the Prophet ﷺ asked Allah to not cause his Ummah to be in disarray and separate into opposing parties and groups, but Allah refused this prayer.

instruction: What is the message that Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was sent to convey to his people?
output: Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) was sent to convey the truth of Allah, which is the Qur'an and guidance.

instruction: What is the responsibility of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) and the believers regarding the denial and mockery of Allah's Ayat?
output: The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)'s responsibility is to convey the message, while the believers' responsibility is to avoid sitting with those who deny or mock Allah's Ayat.

instruction: What does Allah mean when He says, "There is no responsibility for those who have Taqwa upon those who deny"?
output: Allah means that when the believers avoid sitting with wrongdoers, they will be innocent of them and have saved themselves from their sin.

instruction: What does the Ayah command Muslims to do regarding those who take their religion as play and amusement?
output: The Ayah commands Muslims to leave such people, ignore them, and give them respite, for soon, they will taste a tremendous torment.

instruction: What does the term "Tubsal" mean in the context of the Islamic tafsir?
output: Tubsal means, "be submissive," "be exposed," or "be prevented" in the context of the Islamic tafsir.

instruction: What does the phrase "Every person is restrained by what he has earned" mean according to the Qur'an?
output: This phrase means that every person is restrained by the consequences of their actions, with the exception of those on the Right (i.e., the righteous).

instruction: What is the parable of those who revert to disbelief after faith and good deeds?
output: The parable of those who revert to disbelief after faith and good deeds is that of a man who went with some people on a road, but he lost his way and the devils led him to wander in confusion over the land.

instruction: What does the story of the man wandering in the wasteland symbolize?
output: The story symbolizes the example of those who follow false gods instead of Allah, and they will end up destroyed and perhaps eaten by the Jinns.

instruction: What does Allah's statement "وَأُمِرْنَا لِنُسْلِمَ لِرَبِّ الْعَـلَمِينَ" mean?
output: Allah's statement "وَأُمِرْنَا لِنُسْلِمَ لِرَبِّ الْعَـلَمِينَ" means, "we were commanded to submit to the Lord of all that exists." This commandment is to worship Allah in sincerity to Him alone and to perform the prayer and to fear Allah in all circumstances.

instruction: Who did Ibrahim advise and discourage from worshipping idols?
output: Ibrahim advised and discouraged his father Azar from worshipping idols.

instruction: Why did Ibrahim ask Allah to forgive his father?
output: Ibrahim asked Allah to forgive his father out of a promise he had made to him, but when it became clear to him that his father was an enemy to Allah, he disassociated himself from him.

instruction: What does the Ayah "إِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَهِيمُ لاًّبِيهِ ءَازَرَ أَتَتَّخِذُ أَصْنَاماً ءَالِهَةً" mean?
output: The Ayah "إِذْ قَالَ إِبْرَهِيمُ لاًّبِيهِ ءَازَرَ أَتَتَّخِذُ أَصْنَاماً ءَالِهَةً" means, "And (remember) when Ibrahim said to his father Azar: "Do you take idols as gods".

instruction: What does the Ayah "do you dispute with me about Allah while He has guided me to the Truth" mean?
output: The Ayah means, do you argue with me about Allah, other than Whom there is no god worthy of worship, while He has guided me to the Truth and made me aware of it, therefore, how can I ever consider your misguided statements and false doubts?

instruction: What does Prophet Ibrahim's statement, "I fear not those whom you associate with Allah in worship" mean?
output: Ibrahim's statement, "I fear not those whom you associate with Allah in worship," means, these false gods that you worship do not bring about any effect, and I do not fear them or care about them.

instruction: What is the meaning of Prophet Ibrahim's statement, "except when my Lord wills something."?
output: Prophet Ibrahim's statement, "except when my Lord wills something," means, only Allah causes benefit or harm.

instruction: What Ayah was revealed about?
output: The Ayah was revealed about the Quraysh, as stated by Ibn `Abbas, Mujahid and `Abdullah bin Kathir.

instruction: What did the people say when the guidance came to them?
output: The people said, "Has Allah sent a man as Messenger? Say: 'If there were on the earth, angels walking about in peace and security, We should certainly have sent down for them from the heaven an angel as a Messenger.'"

instruction: What did the people claim about the Tawrah that Allah sent down to Musa?
output: The people claimed that the Tawrah was made into separate sheets which they copied from the original and altered, changed and distorted as they wished, saying, "this is from Allah," when in fact, it is not from Allah.

instruction: What is the unjust act that Allah mentions in the Ayah, "And who can be more unjust than he who invents a lie against Allah?"
output: The unjust act that Allah mentions in the Ayah is inventing a lie against Allah, which includes lying about Allah's attributes, claiming partners for Allah, or falsely claiming that Allah has sent someone as a Prophet.

instruction: What does the Ayah, "and who says, 'I will reveal the like of what Allah has revealed.' " refer to?
output: The Ayah refers to someone who claims that the lies they invent rival the revelation that came from Allah.

instruction: What is the condition of the unjust people upon death and on the Day of Resurrection according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The unjust people upon death suffer from hardships, agonies, and afflictions of death. On the Day of Resurrection, they are beaten by angels, and their souls are humiliated and refused to leave their bodies. They are also subjected to torment, vengeance, chains, restraints, Hell, boiling water, and the anger of Allah.

instruction: What does the term "Mustaqar" in the Quran (4:1) signify according to Ibn Masud, Ibn `Abbas, and several others?
output: Mustaqar signifies residence in this life.

instruction: What does the term "Mustawda" in the Quran (4:1) refer to according to most of the scholars who explained it?
output: Mustawda refers to the place of storage after death (the grave).

instruction: What does Allah's statement, "And with it We bring forth vegetation of all kinds," in the Quran (4:1) imply?
output: This implies that from the water We bring forth all kinds of vegetation.

instruction: What does this Ayah refute about the idolators?
output: This Ayah refutes the idolators who worshipped others besides Allah and associated Jinns with Him in worship.

instruction: How did the idolators worship the Jinns?
output: In fact, they worshipped the idols by obeying the Jinns who commanded them to do so.

instruction: What does Allah state in another Ayat about the idolators' worship of Jinns?
output: Allah said in other Ayat, "They invoke nothing but female deities besides Him, and they invoke nothing but Shaytan, a persistent rebel! Allah cursed him. And he Shaytan said: "I will take an appointed portion of your servants. Verily, I will mislead them, and surely, I will arouse in them false desires; and certainly, I will order them to slit the ears of cattle, and indeed I will order them to change the nature created by Allah." (4:117-120)

instruction: What does "Badi' of the heavens and the earth" mean?
output: It means He originated, created, invented, and brought them into existence without precedence.

instruction: What is the origin of the word Bid'ah?
output: Bid'ah comes from the word "Badi' of the heavens and the earth", because it is something that did not have a precedence.

instruction: Why is it improbable that Allah has children?
output: The child is the offspring of two compatible spouses. Allah does not have an equal, none of His creatures are similar to Him, for He alone created the entire creation.

instruction: What do the Basa'ir refer to in Islamic terminology?
output: The Basa'ir refer to the proofs and evidences in the Qur'an and the Message of Allah's Messenger (PBUH).

instruction: What does the Ayah "فَمَنُ اهْتَدَى فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِى لِنَفْسِهِ" mean according to the Islamic tafsir you provided?
output: This Ayah means that whosoever receives guidance, he does so for the good of himself, and whosoever goes astray, he does so at his own loss.

instruction: What is the significance of the Ayah "وَمَا أَنَاْ عَلَيْكُمْ بِحَفِيظٍ" according to the Islamic tafsir you provided?
output: This Ayah means that Allah is not a guardian or responsible for the believers, rather, He only conveys, Allah guides whom He wills and misguides whom He wills.

instruction: What is the command given to the Messenger in the verse "Follow what has been inspired to you from your Lord"?
output: The command is to follow, obey, and act according to what has been revealed to him from his Lord.

instruction: What does the phrase "turn aside from the idolators" mean in this context?
output: It means to forgive them, be forbearing, and endure their harm until Allah brings relief to you, supports you, and makes you triumphant over them.

instruction: What does the statement "And We have not made you Hafiz over them" mean in this tafsir?
output: It means that the Messenger is not a watcher who observes their statements and deeds, nor is he set over them to dispose of their affairs or control their provision. Instead, his only job is to convey the message, not to control or dictate over them.

instruction: What is Allah's prohibition on the Prophet and believers in Surah Al-An'am, verse 108?
output: Allah forbids the Prophet and believers from insulting the false deities of the disbelievers, to avoid the possibility of the disbelievers insulting Allah in retaliation.

instruction: What is the reason behind the prohibition of insulting the false gods of the disbelievers according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The reason behind the prohibition is to prevent the disbelievers from insulting Allah wrongfully without knowledge in retaliation.

instruction: What does the Hadith in Sahih narrate about a person who insults his parents?
output: The Hadith in Sahih narrates that a person who insults his parents is cursed, meaning he insults his father, and that man insults his father, and insults his mother and that man insults his mother.

instruction: What do the idolators vow in the verse 6:109?
output: The idolators vow that if a sign or miracle comes to them, they will believe in it.

instruction: What is the meaning of 'you' in the phrase 'What will make you perceive that (even) if it came, they will not believe' in the verse 6:109?
output: 'You' refers to the idolators in this recitation, according to Mujahid.

instruction: What does Allah mean by saying 'And We shall turn their hearts and their eyes away, as they refused to believe therein for the first time' in the verse 6:109?
output: Allah means that if the idolators were sent back to life, they would still not believe in the signs even if they came, just as We prevented them from faith the first time.

instruction: What does the Ayah "and the dead had spoken unto them" mean in the context of the Islamic tafsir you provided?
output: The Ayah "and the dead had spoken unto them" means that the dead spoke to them, informing them of the truth of what the Messengers brought them.

instruction: What does the Ayah "We had gathered together all things before them" signify according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The Ayah "We had gathered together all things before them" signifies that before their eyes, all things were gathered together, as a demonstration of the truth of what the Messengers brought them.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "they would not have believed, unless Allah willed" in the context of the Islamic tafsir?
output: The phrase "they would not have believed, unless Allah willed" signifies that their belief is dependent on Allah's will for guidance, and He guides whom He wills and misguides whom He wills.

instruction: Who did Allah make enemies for, according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: Allah made enemies for every Prophet who came before and after Prophet Muhammad (PBUH).

instruction: Who are the Shayatin, according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The Shayatin, as referred to in the Ayat, are the devils, both among mankind and the Jinns, who oppose the Messengers.

instruction: What does the term "Tasgha" mean in the Ayat, according to Ibn `Abbas?
output: "Tasgha" means "incline to it", according to Ibn `Abbas. It refers to the hearts, mind, and hearing of those who do not believe in the Hereafter.

instruction: What does the phrase "So be not you of those who doubt" in Surah Yunus (10:94) refer to?
output: The phrase refers to doubt regarding the truth of the revelations given to the Prophet Muhammad.

instruction: What is the significance of the conditional 'if' in Ayah 10:94?
output: The conditional 'if' in Ayah 10:94 does not imply that doubt will ever occur to the Prophet Muhammad; rather, it is a rhetorical device to emphasize the certainty of the truth of the revelations.

instruction: What is the interpretation of the statement "In truth concerning what He stated and in justice concerning what He decided" according to Qatadah?
output: According to Qatadah, the statement "In truth concerning what He stated and in justice concerning what He decided" means that Allah's statements are true without any doubt or speculation, and His commandments are pure justice, without any equivalence.

instruction: What does Allah state most of the people of the earth are?
output: Allah states that most of the people of the earth are misguided.

instruction: In which Ayat does Allah mention that most of the people of the past went astray?
output: Allah mentioned this in Ayat 37:71.

instruction: What are the people who are misguided doing, according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The people who are misguided are following nothing but conjecture and lying, according to the Islamic tafsir.

instruction: What does the statement "Allah allows His servants to eat the slaughtered animals where His Name was mentioned upon slaughtering" mean?
output: It means that Allah permits His followers to eat the meat of animals that were slaughtered while Allah's name was invoked during the process, and not those over which Allah's name was not mentioned.

instruction: What was the practice of the pagans of Quraysh, as mentioned in the tafsir?
output: They used to eat dead animals and consume what was slaughtered for idols.

instruction: What does the phrase "except under compulsion of necessity" in the tafsir refer to?
output: It refers to a situation where one is compelled to eat whatever they can find due to extreme necessity.

instruction: What does the phrase "وَذَرُواْ ظَـهِرَ الإِثْمِ وَبَاطِنَهُ" in the surah Al-'An'am, verse 151, refer to according to Islamic tafsir?
output: It refers to all kinds of sins committed in public and secret.

instruction: What does the term "Al-Ithm" mean according to the saying of Allah's Messenger ﷺ?
output: The sin is that which you find in your heart and you dislike that people become aware of it.

instruction: In what way does the revelation in Surah Al-'An'am, verse 33, encompass sins?
output: It encompasses sins committed in public and secret, whether few or many.

instruction: What is the parable that Allah has given in the Qur'an regarding the disbeliever and the believer?
output: The parable of the disbeliever is one who is in darkness, from which he can never come out, while the believer is one who has been given light, enabling him to walk amongst people.

instruction: What is the meaning of the light mentioned in the Qur'an that the believer is compared to?
output: According to Ibn `Abbas, the light mentioned in the Qur'an is the Qur'an itself. As-Suddi said that the light mentioned is Islam.

instruction: What is the purpose of Allah mentioning the parable of the two parties in the Qur'an?
output: The purpose of Allah mentioning the parable of the two parties is to highlight the difference between the believers and the disbelievers, emphasizing the importance of guidance and the consequences of misguidance.

instruction: What is the meaning of the phrase "Evil Plots of the Leaders of the Criminals and their Subsequent Demise" in the provided Tafsir?
output: In this context, "Evil Plots of the Leaders of the Criminals and their Subsequent Demise" refers to the harmful schemes and strategies that the evil leaders of criminal communities devise in their towns, which lead to their ultimate destruction.

instruction: According to the Tafsir, what is the significance of the phrase "We give the leadership to these wicked ones and they commit evil in it"?
output: According to the Tafsir, the phrase "We give the leadership to these wicked ones and they commit evil in it" signifies that Allah has bestowed leadership on the wicked, who then employ their power to commit evil deeds within the society.

instruction: What does the Tafsir explain about the term "plot" in relation to the evil schemes of disbelievers?
output: In the Tafsir, the term "plot" refers to beautified speech and various actions with which the evil disbelievers call to misguidance. Allah's statement, "But they plot not except against themselves, and they perceive (it) not," signifies that the harm of their wicked plots will only strike them, and they will not misguide others as intended.

instruction: What does the "straight path" in the Qur'an represent, according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The "straight path" in the Qur'an represents Islam, which Allah has legislated for Muslims.

instruction: What does the term "We have detailed Our Ayat" in the tafsir imply?
output: The term "We have detailed Our Ayat" implies that the Qur'an has been explained, made clear, and plain for those who understand it.

instruction: What is the reward for those who comprehend and follow the straight path?
output: The reward for those who comprehend and follow the straight path is Paradise with their Lord, who will be their Protector, Supporter, and Helper because of their good deeds.

instruction: What does the Ayah "قَدِ اسْتَكْثَرْتُم مِّنَ الإِنْسِ" refer to according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The Ayah "Many did you mislead of men" refers to the Jinns' misguiding and leading astray of men in this life.

instruction: Who will give this answer to Allah on the Day of Resurrection, according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The friends of the Jinns among humanity will give this answer to Allah, after Allah chastises them for being misguided by the Jinns.

instruction: What does the phrase "وَبَلَغْنَآ أَجَلَنَا الَّذِى أَجَّلْتَ لَنَا" mean according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The phrase "but now we have reached our appointed term which You did appoint for us" means "death", according to As-Suddi.

instruction: What does Qatadah explain about the wrongdoers in the Ayah, "And thus We do make the wrongdoers supporters of one another"?
output: Qatadah explains that Allah makes the wrongdoers supporters for each other in the Fire by following one another into it.

instruction: What does `Abdur-Rahman bin Zayd bin Aslam comment on Allah's statement, "And thus We do make the wrongdoers supporters of one another"?
output: `Abdur-Rahman bin Zayd bin Aslam comments that it refers to the wrongdoers of the Jinns and mankind.

instruction: What does the Ayah, "And whosoever turns away blindly from the remembrance of the Most Gracious (Allah), We appoint for him Shaytan to be a companion to him" indicate according to Abdur-Rahman bin Zayd bin Aslam?
output: Abdur-Rahman bin Zayd bin Aslam interprets that we appoint the wrongdoer of the Jinns over the wrongdoer of mankind.

instruction: Who will Allah chastise on the Day of Resurrection, according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: Allah will chastise the disbelieving Jinns and humans on the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: When will the Messengers deliver the message to the Jinns and humans according to the tafsir?
output: The Messengers delivered the message to the Jinns and humans during their lifetime.

instruction: Who were the Messengers sent by Allah, according to the tafsir?
output: The Messengers sent by Allah were human beings, not Jinns. It is not claimed that there were Prophets among the Jinns before the time of Ibrahim, but not after that.

instruction: What does the statement "ذَلِكَ أَن لَّمْ يَكُنْ رَّبُّكَ مُهْلِكَ الْقُرَى بِظُلْمٍ وَأَهْلُهَا غَـفِلُونَ" mean in the given Islamic tafsir?
output: This statement means that Allah would not destroy towns for their wrongdoing while their people were unaware, i.e., Allah sent Messengers and revealed the Books to inform people about their wrongdoings. Therefore, Allah did not punish any nation without sending Messengers to them.

instruction: What does Allah's statement "وَلِكُلٍّ دَرَجَـتٌ مِّمَّا عَمِلُواْ" refer to in the given Islamic tafsir?
output: Allah's statement "وَلِكُلٍّ دَرَجَـتٌ مِّمَّا عَمِلُواْ" in the given Islamic tafsir refers to the grades and ranks that Allah gives to disbelievers of the Jinns and mankind according to their evil deeds.

instruction: What does Allah's statement "And your Lord is not unaware of what they do" in the given Islamic tafsir indicate?
output: Allah's statement "And your Lord is not unaware of what they do" indicates that Allah is aware of every deed that people have done, and He will recompense them for their good or evil deeds when they meet Him and return to Him.

instruction: What did the idolators do when they cultivated the land or collected produce?
output: They assigned a part of it to Allah and another part to their idols, keeping the share for the idol, and preserving its division to such an extent that they would collect anything that accidentally falls from the share they assigned to Allah and add it to the share of the idol.

instruction: What did the idolators do when the land or produce they assigned for Allah was accidentally mixed with the share they assigned for the idol?
output: They would say that the idol is poor. Therefore, they would add it to the share they assigned for the idol and would not return it to the share they assigned for Allah.

instruction: What did the idolators do when the water they assigned for Allah irrigated what they assigned for the idol?
output: They would leave it (the produce) for the idol.

instruction: What did Shaytan inspire the idolators to do that led to their children's deaths?
output: Shaytan inspired the idolators to kill their children, either out of fear of poverty or out of fear of dishonor.

instruction: What did the devils command the idolators regarding their daughters?
output: The devils commanded the idolators to kill their daughters to lead them to their own destruction and cause confusion in their religion.

instruction: What does the phrase "So leave them alone with their fabrications" mean in this context?
output: This phrase means to avoid and abandon the idolators and what they do, because Allah will judge between you and them.

instruction: What does the term "Hijr" refer to in the Quran according to Ibn Abbas, Mujahid, Ad-Dahhak, As-Suddi, Qatadah, `Abdur-Rahman bin Zayd bin Aslam, and others?
output: Hijr refers to what the idolators forbade, such as the Wasilah, and the like.

instruction: What does Qatadah comment on the phrase, "They say that such and such cattle and crops are Hijr"?
output: It is a prohibition that the Shayatin appointed for their wealth, and a type of exaggeration and extremism that did not come from Allah.

instruction: What does As-Suddi say about the Ayah, "And none should eat of them except those whom we allow, they claimed..."?
output: They said, "Only those whom we choose can eat of them, and the rest are prohibited from eating them."

instruction: What does the Ayah "And they say: 'What is in the bellies of such and such cattle is for our males alone'" refer to?
output: The Ayah refers to milk.

instruction: What did the people do with the newly born lambs, if it was a male or a female?
output: If the newly born lamb was a male, they would slaughter it and feed it to their males, but not to their females. If the lamb was a female or stillborn, they would not slaughter it, but if it was stillborn, they would share in it (with their females).

instruction: What does the statement "He will punish them for their attribution" mean?
output: It means uttering falsehood, as explained by Allah's statement in Surah Al-An'am, "And say not concerning that which your tongues falsely utter: 'This is lawful and this is forbidden.' so as to invent lies against Allah. Verily, those who invent lies against Allah will never prosper." (16:116)

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "Ma`rushat" in the verse "And it is He Who produces gardens Ma`rushat and not Ma`rushat"?
output: The phrase "Ma`rushat" refers to cultivated gardens, specifically those that are trellised, while "not Ma`rushat" refers to fruits and produce that grow wild inland and on mountains.

instruction: What is the meaning of the verse "but pay the due thereof on the day of their harvest"?
output: On the day of the harvest, the poor should be given a portion of the produce as charity.

instruction: What is the prohibition referred to in the verse "And waste not by extravagance. Verily, He likes not the wasteful"?
output: This prohibition refers to excessive charity beyond normal amounts.

instruction: What do these Ayat in the Quran demonstrate about the Arabs before Islam?
output: These Ayat demonstrate the ignorance of the Arabs before Islam, as they used to prohibit the usage of certain cattle and designated them as Bahirah, Sa'ibah, Wasilah, and Ham, etc.

instruction: What did Allah create according to these Ayat?
output: Allah created gardens, trellised and untrellised, and cattle, as animals of burden and as Farsh (a kind of animal). He created various kinds of cattle, male and female, such as sheep and goats, camels, and cows.

instruction: What does Allah state in these Ayat about the prohibition of certain cattle or their offspring?
output: Allah did not prohibit any of these cattle or their offspring. Rather, they all are created for the benefit of humans, as a source for food, transportation, work, milk, and other benefits.

instruction: What does the Ayah "Say: I find not in that which has been revealed to me anything forbidden to be eaten by one who wishes to eat it" mean?
output: The Ayah means that Muhammad ﷺ does not find any animals that are prohibited, except the ones mentioned here.

instruction: What did Qatadah comment about poured blood?
output: Qatadah commented, "Poured blood was prohibited, but the meat that still has some blood in it is allowed."

instruction: According to Ibn 'Abbas, what was the purpose of the prohibition of certain things during the time of Jahiliyyah?
output: During the time of Jahiliyyah, the people used to eat some things and avoid some other things, because they disliked them. Later on, Allah sent His Prophet ﷺ, revealed His Book, allowed what He allowed, and prohibited what He prohibited. Therefore, whatever Allah allowed is lawful and whatever He prohibited is unlawful. Whatever He did not mention, there is no sin in it.

instruction: What foods were forbidden for the Jews because of their transgression?
output: Allah forbade the Jews from eating certain types of foods, such as the fat of the ox and the sheep, the entrails, and foods that were mixed with bones. This was due to their rebellion and disobedience.

instruction: What do the Jews believe about the prohibition of certain foods?
output: The Jews believe that Israel (a prophet) forbade these foods for himself, and so they also forbade them. However, according to Islamic tafsir, this is not the case, and Allah's forbiddance was due to their rebellion.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "And verily, We are Truthful" in the tafsir?
output: The phrase "And verily, We are Truthful" means that Allah was justified in the penalty He gave the Jews for their wrongdoing, as His forbiddance of these foods for them was not as they claimed. Israel merely forbade these things for himself, and the Jews imitated him.

instruction: What is the message encouraged in the verse "Say: 'Your Lord is the Owner of vast mercy...'"?
output: The message encouraged in the verse is to seek Allah's vast mercy and follow His Messenger.

instruction: What is discouraged in the verse "and never will His wrath be turned back from the people who are criminals."?
output: Defying the Messenger, the Final Prophet, Muhammad ﷺ, is discouraged in this verse.

instruction: Why does Allah often join encouragement with threats in the Qur'an?
output: Allah often joins encouragement with threats in the Qur'an to emphasize the consequences of one's actions and to inspire people to follow the right path.

instruction: What false notion did the idolators have about Allah, according to the tafsir?
output: The idolators believed that Allah had willed and agreed that they indulge in Shirk (associating partners with Allah in worship), forbid certain types of wealth, and that He did not guide them to the true faith.

instruction: How did Allah refute this false notion, as per the tafsir?
output: Allah refuted this notion by stating that if it were true, He would not have harmed them, destroyed them, aided His Messengers over them, and made them taste His painful punishment. He also pointed out that their belief is based on doubts and wishful thinking, and that He has the perfect proof to guide whom He wills and misguide whom He wills.

instruction: According to the tafsir, why did Allah not guide the idolators to the true faith?
output: The tafsir states that Allah did not guide the idolators to the true faith because their belief was based on doubts and wishful thinking, and because it was part of His decree, will, and choice to test them, please the believers, and anger the disbelievers.

instruction: What did Ibn Mas'ud say about the Ayat in Surah Al-An'am 6 that are considered the Mother of the Book (the Qur'an)?
output: Ibn Mas'ud said, "In Surah Al-An'am 6, there are clear Ayat, and they are the Mother of the Book (the Qur'an)."

instruction: What did Al-Hakim record regarding the Ayah "Say: 'Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited you from..."?
output: Al-Hakim recorded that Ibn `Abbas said, "In Surah Al-An'am 6, there are clear Ayat, and they are the Mother of the Book (the Qur'an)." He then recited, "Say: 'Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited you from..."" Al-Hakim said, "Its chain is Sahih, and they did not record it."

instruction: What did Ubadah bin As-Samit say about the Messenger of Allah's statement, "Who among you will give me his pledge to do three things"?
output: Ubadah bin As-Samit said, "The Messenger of Allah said, 'Who among you will give me his pledge to do three things' He then recited the Ayah, 'Say: "Come, I will recite what your Lord has prohibited you from..."' until the end of the Ayat. He then said, 'Whoever fulfills (this pledge), then his reward will be with Allah, but whoever fell into shortcomings and Allah punishes him for it in this life, then that will be his recompense. Whoever Allah delays (his reckoning) until the Hereafter, then his matter is with Allah. If He wills, He will punish him, and if He wills, He will forgive him.'" Al-Hakim said, "Its chain is Sahih and they did not record it."

instruction: What is the meaning of the command "And come not near to the orphan's property, except to improve it"?
output: This commandment means that guardians of orphans should not exploit orphans' property but should work honestly to improve it. They should not mix their food and drink with the orphans' food and drink, and should provide for the orphans until they reach the age of adolescence.

instruction: What does the command "And give full measure and full weight with justice" mean in Islamic law?
output: This commandment means that Muslims should establish justice while giving and taking measures, and not give less or more than what is due. Allah has warned against abandoning this commandment, and those who do so will be punished on the Day of Judgment.

instruction: What does Allah command in the Qur'an regarding testimony?
output: Allah commands just testimony, even if it involves near relatives, and forbids bearing false witness. Muslims should stand out firmly for Allah as just witnesses, establish religion, and make no divisions in it.

instruction: What does the Hadith refer to as "the straight path"?
output: The straight path in the Hadith is Islam.

instruction: What do the two walls symbolize in the Hadith?
output: The two walls symbolize Allah's set limits.

instruction: What does the caller at the gate of the path represent in the Hadith?
output: The caller at the gate of the path represents Allah's Book (the Qur'an).

instruction: Why does Allah praise the Tawrah and its Messenger in the Qur'an?
output: Allah praises the Tawrah and its Messenger, Musa, in the Qur'an to highlight the continuity and confirmation of the revelations from Allah, as well as to emphasize the guidance and mercy they provide to humanity.

instruction: How does Allah describe the Qur'an in the surah 46:12?
output: Allah describes the Qur'an in Surah 46:12 as a confirming book in the Arabic language, a light, and a guidance for mankind.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "tamam'ala az-zahi alladhi ahsana" in the context of the Tawrah and the Qur'an?
output: The phrase "tamam'ala az-zahi alladhi ahsana" means that the Book (either the Tawrah or the Qur'an) is complete, sufficient, and comprehensive for its purpose or recipient, providing a detailed explanation of all things and serving as a guide towards the truth.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Qur'an according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The purpose of the Qur'an, according to the Islamic tafsir, is to serve as Allah's Proof against His creation, thereby providing guidance, clarifying lawful and unlawful matters, offering mercy, and providing a means for hearts to find direction.

instruction: Who were the two sects that the Ayah "عَلَى طَآئِفَتَيْنِ مِن قَبْلِنَا" refers to, according to the tafsir?
output: The Ayah "عَلَى طَآئِفَتَيْنِ مِن قَبْلِنَا" refers to the Jews and Christians, according to Ibn `Abbas, Mujahid, As-Suddi, Qatadah, and several others.

instruction: What does the term "Sadafa" mean in the context of the Qur'an, according to the tafsir?
output: According to As-Suddi's explanation in the tafsir, the term "Sadafa" refers to one who discourages and hinders people from following the Ayat of Allah. Ibn `Abbas, Mujahid, and Qatadah said that Sadafa means, he turned away from it.

instruction: What are the three signs of the Last Hour that will occur before the Day of Resurrection according to the Hadiths?
output: The three signs of the Last Hour that will occur before the Day of Resurrection according to the Hadiths are: * The sun rising from the west * Ad-Dajjal (the Antichrist) * The Beast of the earth

instruction: What does "no good will it do to a person to believe then, if he believed not before" mean according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: "No good will it do to a person to believe then, if he believed not before" means that when a disbeliever believes then, it will not be accepted from him, and it will not benefit him on the Day of Resurrection. This is because the person must have faith before the signs of the Last Hour appear, or he must have earned righteous deeds through his faith.

instruction: What is the significance of Allah's statement, "Say: 'Wait you! We (too) are waiting.'" according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: Allah's statement, "Say: 'Wait you! We (too) are waiting.'" is a stern threat to the disbelievers and a sure promise for those who delay embracing the faith and repenting until a time when faith or repentance shall not avail. This will occur when the sun rises from the west because the Last Hour will then be imminent and its major signs will have begun to appear. The disbelievers are being warned to wait for the signs of the Last Hour, but the believers are also warned to wait because faith or repentance will not avail them at that time.

instruction: Who did the Ayah "Verily, those who divide their religion and break up into sects" refer to according to Mujahid, Qatadah, Ad-Dahhak, As-Suddi, and Ibn 'Abbas?
output: The Ayah refers to the Jews and Christians who divided their religion and broke up into sects.

instruction: What does the Ayah "You have no concern with them in the least" signify according to the tafsir?
output: It signifies that the Messenger is free from the ways of those who dispute in the religion, break into sects, and follow various paths of misguidance, ignorance, sheer opinion, and desires.

instruction: What does Allah's statement "Their affair is only with Allah, Who then will tell them what they used to do" mean according to the tafsir?
output: This statement means that the outcome and judgement of their deeds will be with Allah on the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: How does the Ayah "Whoever comes with good, then he will receive better than that" (28:84) align with the Hadiths regarding the multiplication of good deeds?
output: The Ayah echoes the general principle that the good deed is multiplied tenfold in the Hadiths.

instruction: What are the three types of people who refrain from committing a sin they intended?
output: The three types of people are those who refrain out of fear of Allah, out of forgetfulness or being busy attending to other affairs, or due to being unable to commit it or due to laziness.

instruction: What is the Hadith that states when two Muslims meet with their swords, then the killer and the killed will be in the Fire?
output: The Hadith states, "When two Muslims meet with their swords, then the killer and the killed will be in the Fire." This implies that the one who is killed was eager to kill his companion.

instruction: What does the Qur'an command through the verse "Shall I seek a lord other than Allah..."?
output: The Qur'an commands sincere trust in Allah, emphasizing that He is the Lord of everything, Owner of all things and His is the creation and the decision.

instruction: What does the Qur'an emphasize in the verse "No person earns any (sin) except against himself (only)"?
output: The Qur'an emphasizes Allah's reckoning, decision, and justice, stating that no person shall carry the burden of another person, emphasizing Allah's perfect justice.

instruction: What does the Qur'an imply in the verses "Every person is a pledge for what he has earned. Except those on the Right."?
output: The Qur'an implies that every person will be tied to his evil deeds, but for those on the right -- the believers -- the blessing of their good works will benefit their offspring and relatives, as well.

instruction: What does the statement "And it is He Who has made you generations coming after generations, replacing each other on the earth" mean according to the tafsir?
output: This statement means that Allah made humanity dwell on Earth successively, replacing each other over time and centuries.

instruction: What does Allah's statement "And He has raised you in ranks, some above others" mean according to the tafsir?
output: This statement means that Allah has made human beings different in various aspects such as provision, conduct, qualities, evilness, shapes, and color of skin.

instruction: What does Allah's statement "that He may try you in that which He has bestowed on you" mean according to the tafsir?
output: This statement means that Allah tests humans by giving them wealth and examining how they appreciate and use it. He also tests the poor by testing their patience with their poverty.

instruction: What is the purpose of the Qur'an being revealed according to the tafsir?
output: The purpose of the Qur'an being revealed is to warn the disbelievers and serve as a reminder for the believers.

instruction: What is the instruction for believers in the verse "Follow what has been sent down unto you from your Lord"?
output: The instruction for believers in the verse is to follow and imitate the unlettered Prophet who brought them the Qur'an.

instruction: What is forbidden according to the tafsir in the verse "and follow not any Awliya', besides Him (Allah)"?
output: Following something else instead of adhering to what the Messenger brought and the teachings of the Qur'an is forbidden in this verse.

instruction: What behavior led the nations that were destroyed to disgrace in this life and the Hereafter?
output: The behavior that led the nations that were destroyed to disgrace was defying and rejecting Allah's Messengers.

instruction: What does Allah's statement "Our torment came upon them by night or while they were taking their midday nap" mean?
output: Allah's statement means that His command, torment, and vengeance came over them at night or while they were taking a nap in the middle of the day, during periods of rest and leisure or heedlessness and amusement.

instruction: What does Allah's saying "No cry did they utter when Our torment came upon them but this: 'Verily, we were wrongdoers.'" mean?
output: This means that when the torment came to them, their cry was that they admitted their sins and that they deserved to be punished.

instruction: What is the significance of Weighing of deeds on the Day of Resurrection?
output: The significance of Weighing of deeds on the Day of Resurrection is to ensure justice and fairness in the distribution of rewards and punishments, as Allah will not wrong anyone (23:101).

instruction: What does Allah give to deeds on the Day of Resurrection, turning them into physical objects?
output: Allah gives the deeds physical weight on the Day of Resurrection, making them tangible objects that can be weighed (Tafsir Al-Baghawi).

instruction: What will be weighed on the Balance of the Day of Resurrection, according to different interpretations?
output: According to different interpretations, what will be weighed on the Balance of the Day of Resurrection can be the deeds themselves, the Book of Records where the deeds are recorded, or the persons who performed the deeds.

instruction: What does Allah remind His servants of in the verse 14:34?
output: Allah reminds His servants of His favor on them by creating the earth as a dwelling place, placing mountains and rivers, providing rain, creating means of earnings, and allowing them to utilize the benefits of the earth.

instruction: What does Allah say about most people who receive His blessings?
output: Most people give little thanks for Allah's blessings.

instruction: What does Allah say about man in verse 14:34?
output: Allah says that man is indeed a wrongdoer and ingrate for not fully appreciating or counting the blessings that Allah has bestowed upon him.

instruction: What did Iblis claim prevented him from prostrating before Adam?
output: Iblis claimed that he is better than Adam because he was created from fire while Adam was created from clay.

instruction: What qualities does mud have according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: Mud has the qualities of wisdom, forbearance, patience, and assurance, where plants grow, flourish, increase, and provide good.

instruction: Who was the first to use Qiyas (Analogical Comparison) according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: Iblis was the first to use Qiyas (Analogical Comparison).

instruction: What does the phrase "Get down from this" in Surah Al-A'raf (7:12) mean according to the scholars of Tafsir?
output: The phrase "Get down from this" in Surah Al-A'raf (7:12) means that Iblis was commanded to leave Paradise because he defied Allah's command and disobeyed Him, and was not allowed to remain in a position of arrogance.

instruction: Why was Iblis given the opposite of what he intended (arrogance) according to the tafsir?
output: Iblis was given the opposite of what he intended (arrogance) as a just recompense for his ill intentions, as a form of punishment for disobeying Allah's command.

instruction: What did Iblis ask for when he remembered and asked for respite until the Day of Judgment?
output: Iblis asked for respite until the Day of Judgment, meaning he asked to be allowed to roam the earth until the day when people will be raised up for judgment. Allah granted his request, and Iblis was given the status of being one who is respited.

instruction: What did Iblis (Satan) plan to do according to the Quranic verse "Because You have 'Aghwaytani', surely, I will sit in wait against them (human beings) on Your straight path."?
output: Iblis planned to misguide human beings from the straight path of truth and the way of safety, as mentioned in the Quranic verse.

instruction: What does the phrase 'straight path' refer to in the context of the verse "Because You have 'Aghwaytani', surely, I will sit in wait against them on Your straight path"?
output: The 'straight path' in this context refers to the path of truth and the way of safety, as stated in the tafsir.

instruction: What did Iblis say to the Son of Adam when he sat in the path of Hijrah (migration in the cause of Allah)?
output: Iblis said, "Would you migrate and leave your land and sky" when he sat in the path of Hijrah, as mentioned in the tafsir.

instruction: What does the term `Madh'uman Madhura' mean in the Qur'anic verse 7:18 according to Islamic tafsir?
output: `Madh'uman Madhura' means 'Belittled and despised.'

instruction: Who is the speaker in Qur'anic verse 17:63-65 and what promise are they making to people?
output: The speaker in Qur'anic verse 17:63-65 is Shaytan (Satan), and the promise they are making is nothing but deceit.

instruction: What do Islamic tafsir scholars say about the term `Madh'um' in the Qur'anic verse 7:18?
output: Islamic tafsir scholars interpret `Madh'um' as 'Expelled' or 'Cursed and despised.'

instruction: What was Shaytan's objective when he deceived Adam and Hawwa' about the Forbidden Tree?
output: Shaytan's objective was to make Adam and Hawwa' eat from the Forbidden Tree so that they would not become angels or dwell in Paradise eternally.

instruction: What did Shaytan promise Adam and Hawwa' about the Forbidden Tree?
output: Shaytan promised Adam and Hawwa' that if they ate from the Forbidden Tree, they would attain eternal life and a kingdom that would never waste away.

instruction: What is the meaning of "Yubayyinu Allahu lakum an takunu tadiluu" from Surat Al-Najm (4:176)?
output: "Yubayyinu Allahu lakum an takunu tadiluu" means "So that you do not go astray." This is Allah's way of making it clear to believers lest they stray from His Law.

instruction: What did Adam and Eve use to cover their bodies after leaving the Garden of Eden?
output: After leaving the Garden of Eden, Adam and Eve covered their bodies using fig leaves.

instruction: What did happen to Adam and Eve's private parts after they ate from the forbidden tree?
output: After eating from the forbidden tree, Adam and Eve's private parts became visible to each other.

instruction: Who asked for forgiveness after leaving the Garden of Eden and who asked for respite?
output: Adam asked for forgiveness, and Shaytan (Satan) asked for respite. Each one of them was given what they asked for.

instruction: Who were addressed by the command, "Get down" in Surah Ta Ha, 20:123, as per the Islamic tafsir?
output: Adam, Hawwa', and Iblis were addressed by this command. If the story about the snake is true, then it was also addressed.

instruction: What does the phrase, "On earth will be a dwelling place for you and an enjoyment for a time," mean according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: On earth, humans will have dwellings and known, designated, appointed terms that have been recorded by the Pen, counted by Predestination, and written in the First Record.

instruction: Where will humanity be resurrected for the Day of Resurrection, as per the Islamic tafsir?
output: From the earth, humanity will be resurrected for the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: What do the terms Libas and Rish refer to in Islamic context as mentioned in the tafsir?
output: Libas refers to clothes used to cover the private parts, while Rish refers to outer adornments used for purposes of beautification.

instruction: What does the term Rish include according to Ibn Jarir?
output: Rish includes furniture and outer clothes.

instruction: What does the Ayah, "وَلِبَاسُ التَّقْوَى" mean according to `Abdur-Rahman bin Zayd bin Aslam?
output: When one fears Allah, Allah covers his errors. Hence the "Libas of Taqwa" (that the Ayah mentions) refers to the state where one is covered by the protection of Allah due to one's fear of Him.

instruction: What did disbelievers use to do during Tawaf and why did they claim it was following Allah's command?
output: Disbelievers used to go around the Ka'bah in Tawaf while naked, claiming that they were following the practice of their ancestors and that Allah had commanded them to do so.

instruction: What did women do during Tawaf to cover their sexual organ and what did they say?
output: Women would cover their sexual organ with something during Tawaf, saying, "Today, some or all of it will appear, but whatever appears from it I do not allow it."

instruction: What did the Arabs, with the exception of the Quraysh, do during Tawaf and what did they claim?
output: The Arabs, with the exception of the Quraysh, used to perform Tawaf naked. They claimed they would not make Tawaf while wearing the clothes that they disobeyed Allah in. As for the Quraysh, they used to perform Tawaf in their regular clothes.

instruction: What does Allah command in the Ayah, "Take your adornment to every Masjid"?
output: Allah commands taking proper clothes that cover the private parts when going to the Masjid.

instruction: What does the Ayah, "And eat and drink" mean according to Ibn `Abbas?
output: It means eating and drinking what one wishes, as long as it does not contain extravagance or arrogance.

instruction: What is the meaning of the statement, "It is enough for the Son of Adam to eat a few bites that strengthens his spine"?
output: It means that it is sufficient for a person to eat a moderate amount of food that is enough to maintain his health and strength.

instruction: What does the verse "Who has forbidden the adornment with clothes given by Allah, which He has produced for His servants" refute?
output: This verse refutes those who prohibit any type of food, drink, or clothes according to their own understanding, without relying on what Allah has legislated.

instruction: Who are the idolators being addressed in the verse "Say O Muhammad, to the idolators who prohibit some things out of false opinion and fabrication"?
output: The idolators being addressed in the verse are those who prohibit some things out of false opinion and fabrication.

instruction: What is the purpose of the creation of the things prohibited by the idolators in the verse "Say O Muhammad, to the idolators who prohibit some things out of false opinion and fabrication"?
output: The purpose of the creation of the things prohibited by the idolators is for those who believe in Allah and worship Him in this life, even though the disbelievers share in these bounties in this life. In the Hereafter, the believers will have all this to themselves and none of the disbelievers will have a share in it, for Paradise is prohibited for the disbelievers.

instruction: What does the hadith of the Prophet ﷺ prohibit?
output: The hadith of the Prophet ﷺ prohibits Fahishah, which are sins committed openly or in secret.

instruction: What does the term Ithm mean in the context of the quoted tafsir?
output: The term Ithm in the quoted tafsir means the sin that one commits against himself.

instruction: What does the term "oppression" pertain to in the quoted tafsir?
output: The term "oppression" in the quoted tafsir pertains to transgression against other people.

instruction: What does the phrase "For such their appointed portion will reach them from the Book" refer to?
output: "For such their appointed portion will reach them from the Book" refers to each person's deeds, allotted provisions, and age.

instruction: What is the meaning of the statement "For such their appointed portion will reach them from the Book"?
output: The statement "For such their appointed portion will reach them from the Book" symbolizes the consequences of one's actions, which will be revealed on the Day of Judgment.

instruction: What does Allah mean when He says, "Until when Our messengers come to them to take their souls"?
output: When Allah says, "Until when Our messengers come to them to take their souls," He means that death will come to the idolators, and the angels will come to capture their souls to take them to the Hellfire.

instruction: What does Allah say to those who associate others with Him, invent lies about Him, and reject His Ayat?
output: Allah will say to those who associate others with Him, invent lies about Him, and reject His Ayat, "Enter you in the company of nations who are your likes and similar to you in conduct, Who passed away before you from the earlier disbelieving nations, Of men and Jinn, into the Fire."

instruction: What does Allah mean when He says, "Kulllam aadhaalaa udhakaloo fa-ulaa ikhaarafun mina al-naar" (Every time a new nation enters, it curses its sister nation (that went before))?
output: Allah means that every time a new nation enters the Fire, it curses its sister nation (the one that went before it).

instruction: What does Allah say will happen on the Day of Resurrection according to the Ayah "Yawma tuaqallabu wujooohuhum fi al-naar yaquloona yaltaanana aptsani al-laaha wa aptsani al-rasoolaa" (On the Day when their faces will be turned over in the Fire, they will say: "Oh! Would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger.")?
output: On the Day of Resurrection, those who were led astray will say, "Oh! Would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger."

instruction: What does the phrase "Laa tuftaahulahum abwaabus-samaa'" in the hadith mean?
output: "Laa tuftaahulahum abwaabus-samaa'" means that the disbelievers' good deeds and supplications will not ascend through the gates of the heavens.

instruction: What happens when the wicked soul is ascended to heaven?
output: When the wicked soul is ascended to heaven, it will not pass by a gathering of the angels without being asked, "Who's wicked soul is this?" The reply will be made with the worst names the person was called in this life. When they reach the (lower) heaven, they will ask that its door be opened for the soul, but it will not be opened for it.

instruction: What does the phrase "Wa la yadkhuloona al-jannata hatta yalija al-jamal fi sammi al-khiyati" mean?
output: "Wa la yadkhuloona al-jannata hatta yalija al-jamal fi sammi al-khiyati" means that the disbelievers will not enter paradise until the male camel (Jamal) goes through the eye of the needle. Ibn Mas'ud said it is a male camel from the she camel, or it refers to the spouse of the she camel.

instruction: What is the state of those who believe and perform good deeds according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: Those who believe and perform good deeds have their hearts purified and are the dwellers of Paradise, where they will abide.

instruction: What happens to the believers after they are saved from the Fire?
output: After the believers are saved from the Fire, they will be kept in wait by a bridge between Paradise and Hellfire. Transgressions between them will be judged, and they will be purified and cleansed before they are given permission to enter Paradise.

instruction: What is the significance of the rivers flowing under the dwellers of Paradise in the Islamic tafsir?
output: The rivers flowing under the dwellers of Paradise represent a cleansing drink and a bath, purifying their hearts of hatred and imparting a radiant glow to their faces, respectively.

instruction: What does the term "People of Hellfire will feel Anguish upon Anguish" refer to in the Islamic tafsir?
output: The term "People of Hellfire will feel Anguish upon Anguish" refers to the dwellers of the Fire who will be addressed, chastised, and admonished when they take their places in the Fire.

instruction: What does the verse "This is the Fire which you used to belie. Is this magic or do you not see Taste you therein its heat and whether you are patient of it or impatient of it, it is all the same. You are only being requited for what you used to do" mean in the Islamic tafsir?
output: The verse "This is the Fire which you used to belie. Is this magic or do you not see Taste you therein its heat and whether you are patient of it or impatient of it, it is all the same. You are only being requited for what you used to do" means that the disbelievers will be punished for the claims they used to utter in this life, and they will experience the pain and heat of the Fire regardless of whether they are patient or impatient.

instruction: What does the phrase "Allah's statement, فَأَذَّنَ مُؤَذِّنٌ بَيْنَهُمْ(Then a crier will proclaim between them)" in the Islamic tafsir refer to?
output: The phrase "Allah's statement, فَأَذَّنَ مُؤَذِّنٌ بَيْنَهُمْ(Then a crier will proclaim between them)" refers to a crier who will herald and announce, "The curse of Allah is on the wrongdoers," and will describe them by saying, "Those who hindered (men) from the path of Allah, and would seek to make it crooked." The crier will announce the curse of Allah on the wrongdoers, who hindered people from following Allah's path, His Law, and what the Prophets brought. They sought to make Allah's path appear crooked and winding, so that no one would follow it.

instruction: What does the Ayah "Of what benefit to you was your gathering..." mean?
output: The Ayah means, your great numbers and wealth did not save you from Allah's torment. Rather, you are dwelling in His torment and punishment.

instruction: What does the phrase "and your arrogance" in the same Ayah signify?
output: This phrase means, your great numbers and wealth did not save you from Allah's torment. Instead, it shows that you were arrogant and proud, which led to your downfall.

instruction: Who are the people being referred to in the phrase "Are they those, of whom you swore that Allah would never show them mercy"?
output: The people being referred to are the dwellers of Al-A'raf, a place in the Hereafter where they will be told when Allah decrees that they can enter Paradise without fear or grief.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "So this Day We shall forget them as they forgot their meeting of this Day of theirs" in Islamic tafsir?
output: In Islamic tafsir, the phrase signifies that Allah will forget the good about disbelievers, but not their evil, as a just recompense for them for forgetting the meeting of the Day of Judgment.

instruction: What does Allah's statement "We shall leave them in the Fire" imply according to Mujahid's interpretation?
output: According to Mujahid's interpretation, Allah's statement "We shall leave them in the Fire" implies that we will abandon them in the Fire, leaving them without any mercy, just as they left any action on behalf of the meeting on this Day of theirs.

instruction: What does Allah promise to the disbelievers according to the hadith narrated in the Sahih?
output: According to the hadith narrated in the Sahih, Allah promises the disbelievers that they will be left in the Fire, without any mercy, and He will say to the servant on the Day of Resurrection, "Then this Day, I will forget you as you have forgotten Me."

instruction: What does the Ayah "We have explained in detail with knowledge" in the Quran imply?
output: The Ayah "We have explained in detail with knowledge" implies that Allah has perfect knowledge of what He explained in the Quran and has explained it in detail.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "And We never punish until We have sent a Messenger (to give warning)" in the Quran?
output: The phrase "And We never punish until We have sent a Messenger (to give warning)" signifies that Allah does not punish without sending a Prophet to warn people.

instruction: What is the meaning of the part "On the Day the event is finally fulfilled" in the Quran?
output: The part "On the Day the event is finally fulfilled" refers to the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: What does the Qur'an say about the creation of the universe?
output: The Qur'an states that Allah created the universe, the heavens, the earth, and all that is in, on, and between them in six days.

instruction: What are the six days of creation according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: According to the Islamic tafsir, the six days of creation are: Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday.

instruction: What does the term 'Istawa' mean in Islamic theology?
output: In Islamic theology, 'Istawa' means that Allah 'rose' or 'settled' over the Throne. However, its true essence is not to be discussed or equated with the creation.

instruction: What does Allah command His servants to do, ensuring their welfare in this life and the Hereafter?
output: Allah commands His servants to supplicate to Him, in humbleness and humility.

instruction: What does the Hadith mention about supplications and purification?
output: It mentions that there will be some people who transgress in supplication and purification.

instruction: What is prohibited according to Allah's statement, "And do not do mischief on the earth, after it has been set in order"?
output: Causing mischief on the earth, especially after it has been set in order.

instruction: What is the significance of rain in Islamic theology?
output: Rain in Islamic theology is a sign of Allah's mercy and power. It is through rain that Allah brings life to the earth and sustains living beings.

instruction: What does the term "bayna yaday rahmatihi" mean in the context of the Quran?
output: "Bayna yaday rahmatihi" means 'before His mercy'. In this context, it refers to before the rain falls.

instruction: In what ways does the Quran illustrate the Day of Resurrection using the example of rain and dead land?
output: The Quran compares the Day of Resurrection to the revival of dead land with rain. Just as rain brings life to dead land, Allah will bring the dead back to life on the Day of Resurrection after they have disintegrated.

instruction: Who was Nuh, and who were his ancestors?
output: Nuh was the first Messenger Allah sent to the people of the earth after Adam. His name was Nuh bin Lamak bin Matushalakh bin Khanukh. Khanukh was the Prophet Idris, who was the first person to write letters using a pen and was the son of Barad bin Mahlil, bin Qanin bin Yanish bin Shith bin Adam.

instruction: What did the leaders of Nuh's people say in response to his message?
output: The leaders of his people said, "Verily, we see you in plain error," because of his call to abandon the worship of their idols.

instruction: What did Nuh say in response to their accusations, and what does this signify about the attributes of a Messenger?
output: Nuh said, "O my people! There is no error in me, but I am a Messenger from the Lord of all that exists!" This signifies that the attributes of a Messenger include conveying messages in plain, yet eloquent words, giving sincere advice, and having extensive knowledge about Allah. Indeed, no other people can compete with the Prophets in this regard.

instruction: What was the purpose of Allah sending down revelation to a man among the Muslims?
output: The purpose of Allah sending down revelation to a man among the Muslims was as mercy, kindness and compassion for them, so that he could warn them to avoid Allah's torment by associating none with Him.

instruction: What was the reaction of the people towards the man who received revelation?
output: The people initially refused to believe him and opposed him, and only a few of them believed in him.

instruction: What happened to the disbelievers who opposed the revelation?
output: Allah saved the man and his followers, while the disbelievers were drowned and admitted into the Fire, as they found none to help them except Allah.

instruction: Who were the people of `Ad and from which tribe were they descendants?
output: The people of `Ad were descendants of `Ad, son of Iram, son of `Aws, son of Nuh.

instruction: Where did the people of `Ad live and where was Prophet Hud buried?
output: The people of `Ad lived in Yemen, in the area of Ahqaf. Prophet Hud was buried in the vicinity of a red sand mound in the area of Ahqaf.

instruction: What did the leaders of those who disbelieved among Hud's people say about him?
output: The leaders of those who disbelieved among Hud's people said, "Verily, we see you in foolishness, and verily, we think you are one of the liars," meaning, you are misguided because you call us to abandon worshipping the idols in order to worship Allah Alone.

instruction: What did the people of Hud say when Muhammad bin Ishaq came to them?
output: They said, "You have come to us that we should worship Allah Alone."

instruction: What did the people of `Ad say when Prophet Hud warned them about their idol worship?
output: They said, "O Hud! No evidence have you brought us, and we shall not leave our gods for your (mere) saying! And we are not believers in you. All that we say is that some of our gods have seized you with evil."

instruction: What did the emissary of `Ad do that led to their destruction?
output: The emissary of `Ad, whose name was Qayl, passed by Mu`awiyah bin Bakr and stayed with him for a month. Mu`awiyah supplied him with alcoholic drinks, and two female singers were singing for him. When a month ended, Qayl went to the mountains of Muhrah and asked Allah for water. Black clouds came, and he picked one, which turned out to be a wind that destroyed the people of `Ad.

instruction: Who were the Thamud and where did they descend from?
output: The Thamud were a tribe of ancient Arabs who descended from Thamud bin `Athir bin Iram bin Sam bin Nuh. They dwelled between the area of the Hijaz (Western Arabia) and Ash-Sham (Greater Syria).

instruction: What did Thamud ask Prophet Salih to produce as a miracle?
output: Thamud asked Prophet Salih to produce a camel from a solid rock called Al-Katibah, which they chose.

instruction: What was the fate of the she-camel, which was produced from the rock, and its offspring?
output: The she-camel, which was a miracle sent by Allah, remained in Thamud's territory, as well as its offspring after it delivered its offspring. The offspring was visibly moving in its belly, and it was pregnant. The camel and its offspring were a source of water for both Thamud and the camel, as they took turns drinking from its well. However, the disbelieving Thamud eventually conspired to kill the camel and its offspring. Allah destroyed Thamud for their sin after they killed the camel.

instruction: Who did the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) address in the quote, and why?
output: The Prophet Muhammad (PBUH) addressed three prominent leaders of the Quraish tribe, namely Abu Jahl bin Hisham, `Utbah bin Rabi`ah, and Shaybah bin Rabi`ah. He did so to ask them if they had experienced the punishments their Lord had promised them, in contrast to the victory and triumph he himself received from his Lord.

instruction: Who is `Umar in this context, and what did he say to the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)?
output: `Umar is one of the companions of the Prophet Muhammad (PBUH). He said to the Prophet, "O Allah's Messenger! Why do you speak to a people who have rotted (meaning, who are unresponsive and disbelieving)?"

instruction: What did Prophet Salih say to his people, and what was their response?
output: Prophet Salih told his people, "I have indeed conveyed to you the Message of my Lord, and have given you good advice," but his people did not benefit from it because they did not like the Truth and did not follow those who gave them sincere advice, as they preferred not to heed good advisers.

instruction: Who was Lut (Lot) and what was his relationship with Ibrahim (Abraham)?
output: Lut was the son of Haran, the son of Azar (Terah), and he was the nephew of Ibrahim. He had migrated with Ibrahim to the Sham area.

instruction: Why did Allah send Lut to the people of Sadum and the surrounding villages?
output: Allah sent Lut to the people of Sadum and the surrounding villages to call them to Allah, enjoin righteousness, and forbid them from their evil practices, their sin, and wickedness.

instruction: What was the unique sin committed by the people of Lut that was unheard of among the children of Adam before?
output: The people of Lut engaged in sexual intercourse with males instead of females. This practice was not known among the Children of Adam before.

instruction: Who were the only believers in the household of Lut?
output: The only believers in Lut's household were his family members, excluding his wife.

instruction: What was the fate of Lut's wife as per the Islamic tafsir?
output: Lut's wife did not leave the town and was not part of the believers who were saved. She was destroyed along with her people, according to the tafsir.

instruction: What does the verse "And We rained down on them a rain" refer to, according to the tafsir?
output: The verse "And We rained down on them a rain" refers to the torrent of stones that Allah rained down on the people of Lut, as mentioned in 11:82-83.

instruction: Who were the people of Madyan and where was their city and tribe located?
output: The people of Madyan were the descendants of Madyan, son of Midyan, son of Ibrahim. Their city and tribe were located close to Ma'an on route to the Hijaz (from Ash-Sham).

instruction: What was the main message that Shu`ayb conveyed to his people?
output: Shu`ayb's main message to his people was to worship Allah, give full measure and full weight, and not to wrong men in their dealings.

instruction: Why was Shu`ayb called the 'Speaker of the Prophets'?
output: Shu`ayb was called the 'Speaker of the Prophets' because of his eloquent words and eloquent advice.

instruction: What did Prophet Shu`ayb warn his people against?
output: Prophet Shu`ayb warned his people against setting up blockades on the roads, threatening people with death if they do not give up their money, as they were bandits.

instruction: What did the believers represent in the context of Prophet Shu`ayb's warning?
output: In the context of Prophet Shu`ayb's warning, the believers represented those who followed him on the path of Allah.

instruction: What does the phrase "وَاذْكُرُواْ إِذْ كُنتُمْ قَلِيلاً فَكَثَّرَكُمْ" mean?
output: The phrase "وَاذْكُرُواْ إِذْ كُنتُمْ قَلِيلاً فَكَثَّرَكُمْ" means, "Remember when you were but few, and He multiplied you." This phrase reminds the people of their weak beginnings and the favor of Allah in increasing their numbers.

instruction: What do the chiefs' words "Even though we hate it" mean in the context of the Ayah?
output: "Even though we hate it" means, would you force us to do that, even though we hate what you are calling us to.

instruction: What does the phrase "And it is not for us to return to it unless Allah, our Lord, should will" refer to?
output: The phrase "And it is not for us to return to it unless Allah, our Lord, should will" refers to the act of reversion to their previous disbeliever's religion.

instruction: What does the Ayah represent when it says "In Allah (Alone) we put our trust"?
output: The Ayah represents that in all matters, they put their trust in Allah, concerning all their affairs, what they practice of them and what they ignore.

instruction: What punishment did Allah inflict upon the people who threatened to expel Shu`ayb and his followers?
output: Allah inflicted an earthquake upon them as punishment for threatening to expel Shu`ayb and his followers.

instruction: What event is mentioned in Ayah 11:94?
output: Ayah 11:94 mentions the Sayhah (cry) that struck the wrongdoers after they mocked Shu`ayb.

instruction: What forms of punishment did Allah mention in Surat Ash-Shu`ara' for the people who challenged Shu`ayb?
output: In Surat Ash-Shu`ara', Allah mentioned the torment of the Day of Shadow (a gloomy cloud), a cry from the sky, a tremor from beneath, and their souls being captured, their lives being taken, and their bodies becoming idle.

instruction: Who did Shu`ayb claim to have conveyed messages from?
output: Shu`ayb claimed to have conveyed messages from his Lord.

instruction: What did Shu`ayb say he gave to his people in addition to conveying messages from his Lord?
output: Shu`ayb said he gave good advice to his people.

instruction: How did Shu`ayb express his feelings towards his disbelieving people?
output: Shu`ayb expressed that he would not feel any sorrow for his disbelieving people.

instruction: What were the Ba'sa' and Darra' that struck the earlier nations?
output: Ba'sa' refers to physical sicknesses and ailments, while Darra' refers to poverty and humiliation.

instruction: What does the phrase "until they `Afaw" in the Ayah signify?
output: It refers to increase in numbers, wealth, and offspring.

instruction: What is the Hadith that explains the matter of the believer, and what does it mean?
output: The Hadith is "The matter of the believer is amazing, for nothing that Allah decrees for him, but it is better for him. If a Darra' (harm) strikes him, he is patient, and this is better for him, if he is given Sarra' (prosperity), he thanks (Allah) for it and this is better for him." This Hadith means that the believer is aware of the test behind the afflictions, whether it may be prosperity or adversity that Allah sends to him, as well as the blessings.

instruction: What does the Ayah "Was there any town (community) that believed (after seeing the punishment), and its faith (at that moment) saved it (from the punishment) -- Except the people of Yunus; when they believed, We removed from them the torment of disgrace in the life of the (present) world, and permitted them to enjoy for a while" (10:98) indicate?
output: This Ayah indicates that no city believed in its entirety, except the city of Prophet Yunus, for they all believed after they were stricken by punishment.

instruction: What did Allah send Prophet Yunus to?
output: Allah sent Prophet Yunus to a hundred thousand (people) or even more.

instruction: What does the Ayah "And if the people of the towns had believed and had Taqwa. .." (34:34) refer to?
output: This Ayah refers to the hearts of the people having faith in what the Messenger brought them, believed and obeyed him, and had Taqwa by performing the acts of obedience and abstaining from the prohibitions.

instruction: Who did Allah refer to when He said, "is it not a guidance for those who inherit the earth from its previous inhabitants"?
output: Allah referred to those who succeeded the previous nations that lived on the earth.

instruction: What did Mujahid and several others comment on regarding Allah's statement, "Did We not make clear to them that had We willed, We would have punished them because of their sins"?
output: Mujahid and several others said that Allah was pointing out that He could have punished them in the same manner as the previous nations, but instead, He gave them a chance.

instruction: What did Abu Ja`far bin Jarir At-Tabari explain about the Ayah, "And We seal up their hearts, so that they hear not"?
output: Abu Ja`far bin Jarir At-Tabari explained that Allah places a cover over their heart, making them unable to hear advice or warnings.

instruction: What does Allah say in the Quran about the towns He mentions to Prophet Muhammad (PBUH)?
output: Allah says that those towns are some of the news of the towns that Allah relates to Prophet Muhammad (PBUH), and some of them have been reaped (destroyed), while some are still standing.

instruction: What does Allah's statement "We never punish until We have sent a Messenger (to give warning)" in Surah Al-An'am (17:15) signify?
output: This statement signifies that Allah does not punish a people until He has sent a Messenger to them to give warning.

instruction: According to the Tafsir of Ibn `Atiyyah, why did most of the previous nations not believe in what the Messengers brought them?
output: According to Ibn `Atiyyah, most of the previous nations did not believe in what the Messengers brought them because they denied the truth when it first came to them, although they recognized it.

instruction: Who did Allah send after the previous Prophets, as mentioned in the passage?
output: Allah sent Prophet Musa with clear evidences and proofs to Fir`awn and his chiefs.

instruction: What was the reaction of Fir`awn and his chiefs towards the signs sent by Prophet Musa?
output: Fir`awn and his chiefs wrongfully rejected and denied the signs sent by Prophet Musa, out of injustice and stubbornness on their part.

instruction: What did Allah say about Fir`awn and his people in another Ayah?
output: In another Ayah, Allah said that they belied the signs, though they were themselves convinced thereof and suffered a disgraceful punishment. Allah caused them to drown, all of them, while Musa and his people were watching.

instruction: What does Musa claim about the one who sent him, according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: Musa claims that the one who sent him is the Creator, Lord, and King of all things.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "Proper it is for me that I say nothing concerning Allah but the truth"?
output: This phrase signifies that it is incumbent and a duty for Musa to convey only the Truth from Allah, because of what he knows of Allah's might and power.

instruction: What does Musa mean by "I have come unto you from your Lord with a clear proof"?
output: Musa means that he has brought unequivocal evidence that Allah gave him to prove that he is conveying the truth to the people of Fir`awn, indicating that his mission is authentic and backed by evidence.

instruction: What does the term "Thu`ban serpent" refer to in this Islamic tafsir?
output: The term "Thu`ban serpent" refers to a male snake.

instruction: What happened when Fir`awn saw the snake rushing towards him?
output: When Fir`awn saw the snake rushing towards him, he jumped from his throne and cried to Musa for help, so that Musa would remove the snake from his way.

instruction: What was the significance of Musa's hand being white after he took it out of his cloak?
output: Musa's hand being white after he took it out of his cloak was not because of leprosy or sickness. It was a miraculous event as Allah said in another Ayah, "And put your hand into your bosom, it will come forth white without hurt."

instruction: What did the people of Fir`awn claim about Musa, according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The people of Fir`awn claimed that Musa was a magician.
