output: "You are only a warner" means that the Prophet's role is to convey the Message and warn them, and Allah leaves astray whomsoever He wills and guides whomsoever He wills. The Prophet is a bearer of glad tidings to the believers and a warner to the disbelievers.

instruction: What does Allah reveal about His perfect power of creation?
output: Allah reveals that His power of creation is perfect, as He can make different kinds of things from one thing, like water into various fruits.

instruction: What does Allah mean by "Al-Judad"?
output: Al-Judad means pathways, according to some tafsir scholars.

instruction: Who are the people that fear Allah, according to the Ayah "It is only those who have knowledge among His servants that fear Allah"?
output: Those who have knowledge among His servants that fear Allah are those who know about Ar-Rahman (The All-Merciful), do not associate anything in worship with Him, accept as lawful that which He has permitted and as unlawful that which He has prohibited, obey His commands, and are certain that they will meet Him and be brought to account for their deeds.

instruction: What does Allah promise for His believing servants who recite and believe in His Book and do the deeds prescribed in it?
output: Allah promises them a reward that will inevitably be theirs and He may give them a reward for what they have done, and multiply it by adding more.

instruction: What does the phrase "They hope for a (sure) trade-gain that will never perish" mean in the context of this tafsir?
output: It means that the believers hope for a reward from Allah which will inevitably be theirs.

instruction: What does Allah mean by "He may pay them their wages in full, and give them (even) more, out of His grace"?
output: It means that Allah may give them a reward for what they have done, and multiply it by adding more as a grace.

instruction: What does the Qur'an confirm according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The Qur'an confirms the previous books.

instruction: What does the phrase "it is the (very) truth confirming that which was (revealed) before it" in the verse mean?
output: It means that the Qur'an is the true Book of Allah and it confirms the previous books.

instruction: What does the verse "Verily, Allah is indeed All-Aware and All-Seer of His servants" suggest about Allah?
output: It suggests that Allah is All-Aware of His servants, knowing who deserves to receive His blessings.

instruction: What are the three types of people mentioned in the verse "Then We gave the Book as inheritance to such of Our servants whom We chose."?
output: The three types of people are those who wrong themselves, those who follow a middle course, and those who are foremost in good deeds.

instruction: Who are the scholars in Islamic context and what are their virtues according to the Hadith narrated by Ibn 'Abbas?
output: The scholars are the ones who seek knowledge and follow the straight path. They are the most fortunate of people, the most entitled to Allah's mercy, and their superiority over the worshippers is like that of the moon over all other heavenly bodies. They are the heirs of the Prophets.

instruction: What does the Hadith narrated by Abu Ad-Darda' imply about the forgiveness for the scholars?
output: The Hadith implies that the angels in the heavens and on earth ask for forgiveness for the scholars from Allah, and that forgiveness is granted for them till the last day.

instruction: What will the believers be adorned with in Paradise?
output: They will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls.

instruction: What will the garments of the believers be in Paradise?
output: Their garments will be of silk.

instruction: What does the verse "where toil will touch us not nor weariness will touch us" mean in the context of the hadith?
output: It means that neither their bodies nor their souls will become exhausted in Paradise.

instruction: What is the fate of the disbelievers in Hell?
output: The disbelievers will be in the fire of Hell, neither dying nor living. This implies they will experience eternal torment.

instruction: What does Allah mean when He says, "Did We not give you lives long enough"?
output: Allah is saying that the disbelievers had long enough lives in this world for them to benefit from admonition and the warnings of the Prophets.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase, "The warner came to you"?
output: The phrase signifies the coming of the Prophets and Messengers to guide humanity, but the disbelievers chose to disregard their guidance.

instruction: What does the word "Khaleefa" in the verse "He it is Who has made you successors generations after generations in the earth" mean?
output: "Khaleefa" means that all people succeed one another, generation after generation.

instruction: What does the statement "so whosoever disbelieves, on him will be his disbelief" imply?
output: It means that the person who disbelieves will have to bear the consequences of that disbelief.

instruction: What does the phrase "the disbelief of the disbelievers adds nothing but hatred of their Lord" signify?
output: It means that the longer the disbelievers persist in their disbelief, the more Allah hates them, and the longer they persist in it, the more they and their families will lose on the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: What does Allah tell the idolators to show Him in response to their call upon false deities?
output: Allah tells the idolators to show Him what they have created of the earth, implying that they have nothing at all, they do not possess even the membrane covering the stone of a date.

instruction: What does the phrase "Or have We given them a Book, so that they act on clear proof therefrom" imply?
output: This implies that Allah did not reveal a Book to the idolators on which they base their Shirk and disbelief.

instruction: What does the statement "Nay, the wrongdoers promise one another nothing but delusions" mean?
output: This means that the wrongdoers are merely following their own whims, opinions, and wishes which are their personal desires, and they are no more than misguidance and falsehood.

instruction: What did Quraysh and the Arabs swear by Allah before the Prophet came to them?
output: They swore by Allah their most binding oath that if a warner (a prophet) came to them, they would be more guided than any of the nations to whom Messengers had been sent.

instruction: What does the verse "And indeed they (Arab pagans) used to say: "If we had a reminder as had the men of old, We would have indeed been the chosen servants of Allah!" mean?
output: This verse means that the Arabs used to say that if they had been given a reminder (the Qur'an) like the ones given to the people of old, they would have indeed been the chosen servants of Allah.

instruction: What does the verse "But the evil plot encompasses only him who makes it" mean?
output: This verse means that the evil consequences of a plot will come back upon those who made it and not on others.

instruction: What does Allah say about the Bad Consequences of disbelieving in the Prophets?
output: Allah says that if people disbelieve in the Prophets, they will face destruction, and their wealth, livestock, and homes will not protect them from Allah's punishment.

instruction: What does the Ayah "وَلكِن يُؤَخِّرُهُمْ إلَى أَجَلٍ مُّسَمًّى" mean?
output: This Ayah means that Allah gives them respite to an appointed term, meaning He delays their punishment until the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: What is the significance of Allah being Ever All-Seer of His servants according to the Tafsir of Surah Fatir?
output: In the Tafsir of Surah Fatir, it is stated that when their term comes, Allah is Ever All-Seer of His servants, meaning He will bring them to account and will reward or punish each one according to their deeds on the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: What is the virtue of reciting Surah Ya Sin in the night?
output: According to the tafsir, whoever recites Surah Ya Sin in the night will wake up forgiven.

instruction: What is the meaning of "Truly, you are one of the Messengers, on the straight path" in Surah Ya Sin?
output: This means that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is one of the Messengers who has been sent on the straight path, following a straight methodology and religion, and an upright Law.

instruction: Who are the people that the verse "In order that you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned" refers to?
output: The verse refers to the Arabs, for no warner had come to them before the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ.

instruction: What does Allah do to the Doomed in terms of guidance?
output: Allah puts a chain around their necks and their hands are tied under their chin so that their heads are raised up, and their hands are placed over their mouths, so they are restrained from doing anything good.

instruction: What does the Ayah "إِنَّ الَّذِينَ حَقَّتْ عَلَيْهِمْ كَلِمَةُ رَبِّكَ لاَ يُؤْمِنُونَ - وَلَوْ جَآءَتْهُمْ كُلُّ ءايَةٍ حَتَّى يَرَوُاْ الْعَذَابَ الاٌّلِيمَ" (Truly, those, against whom the Word (wrath) of your Lord has been justified, will not believe, Even if every sign should come to them, until they see the painful torment) mean?
output: This Ayah means that Allah has decreed that they will be misguided, so warning them will not help them and will not have any effect on them. Even if all signs come to them, they will not believe until they see the painful torment.

instruction: What does the Hadith "Whoever starts (or sets an example of) something good in Islam, will have a reward for it, and a reward equal to that of everyone who does it after him, without that detracting from their reward in the slightest. Whoever starts (or sets an example of) something evil in Islam, will bear the burden for that, and a burden equal to that of everyone who does it after him, without that detracting from their burden in the slightest." mean?
output: This Hadith means that whoever starts (or sets an example of) something good in Islam, will have a reward for it, and a reward equal to that of everyone who does it after him, without that detracting from their reward in the slightest. Whoever starts (or sets an example of) something evil in Islam, will bear the burden for that, and a burden equal to that of everyone who does it after him, without that detracting from their burden in the slightest.

instruction: What did the people of the Prophet Moses say when good or evil befell them?
output: When good befell them, they said, "This is ours," and if evil afflicted them, they ascribed it to evil omens connected with Moses and those with him.

instruction: What did the people of Salih say when they saw the Prophet Salih and his companions?
output: They said, "We augur ill omen from you and those with you." The Prophet Salih responded, "Your ill omen is with Allah."

instruction: What does the Ayah (7:131) mean when it says, "Their evil omens are with Allah"?
output: This means that their evil omens are not with the Prophet Moses and his companions, but are with Allah. The same concept is mentioned in the Ayah (27:47) where the people of Salih said, "We augur ill omen from you and those with you." The Prophet Salih responded, "Your ill omen is with Allah." This also applies to the Ayah (4:78) where Allah says, "All things are from Allah, so what is wrong with these people that they fail to understand any word."

instruction: What did the Prophet Nuh (AS) urge his people to follow?
output: The Prophet Nuh (AS) urged his people to follow the Messengers who had come to them.

instruction: What does the phrase "Obey those who ask no wages of you" mean in this context?
output: It means to obey the Messengers for the Message which they convey, and they are rightly-guided in what they are calling the people to, the worship of Allah Alone with no partner or associate.

instruction: What is the meaning of the phrase "and to Whom you shall be returned" in this tafsir?
output: It means that on the Day of Resurrection, when He will requite you for your deeds: if they are good then you will be rewarded and if they are evil then you will be punished.

instruction: What does the phrase "Alas for mankind!" in the Quran mean, according to Ibn Abbas?
output: "Alas for mankind!" means, "Alas for mankind, who have neglected the command of Allah."

instruction: What is the false belief that Allah refutes in the Quran about the cycle of reincarnation?
output: The false belief that Allah refutes in the Quran about the cycle of reincarnation is the belief that "There is nothing but our life of this world! We die and we live!" (23:37). This was the belief in the cycle of reincarnation; in their ignorance they believed that they would come back to this world as they had been before.

instruction: What does Allah's saying "And surely, all -- everyone of them will be brought before Us" mean?
output: Allah's saying "And surely, all -- everyone of them will be brought before Us" means, all of the past nations and those that are yet to come, will be gathered and brought to account before Allah, may He be glorified and exalted, on the Day of Judgement, and they will be requitted according to their good and evil deeds. This is like the Ayah: "And verily, to each of them your Lord will repay their works in full." (11:111).

instruction: What is the sign that Allah mentions to prove the existence of the Creator and His ability to resurrect the dead?
output: The sign that Allah mentions to prove the existence of the Creator and His ability to resurrect the dead is the transformation of dead land into lush vegetation and the provision of crops and fruits.

instruction: What is the interpretation of the Ayah "and their hands made it not" according to Ibn `Abbas and Qatadah?
output: According to Ibn `Abbas and Qatadah, the interpretation of the Ayah "and their hands made it not" is that all the blessings mentioned, such as crops and fruits, could only come about by the mercy of Allah towards them, not by their own efforts and labor and strength.

instruction: What is the other interpretation of the Ayah "and their hands made it not" according to Ibn Jarir?
output: According to Ibn Jarir, the other interpretation of the Ayah "and their hands made it not" is that they eat from the fruits provided by Allah's bounty and from what their own hands have done, i.e., by planting the seeds and tending the plants. Ibn Jarir mentioned other possible interpretations in his Tafsir, but this is the interpretation that he favored.

instruction: What does the Ayah "And the sun runs on its fixed course for a term. That is the decree of the Almighty, the All-Knowing" mean, according to the tafsir?
output: The Ayah refers to the sun's constant motion in its orbit, beneath the Throne, following a pattern in which there are no differences or inversions, as Allah has decreed. The sun's orbit is a fixed course for a term, and it does not exceed that.

instruction: What is the meaning of the phrase "lumustagarruh lahahaa" in the Ayah "وَالشَّمْسُ تَجْرِى لِمُسْتَقَرٍّ لَّهَـا ذَلِكَ تَقْدِيرُ الْعَزِيزِ الْعَلِيمِ" according to the two views mentioned in the tafsir?
output: (1) It refers to the sun's fixed course of location, which is beneath the Throne, beyond the earth in that direction. (2) It refers to the sun's fixed course of time, which will be on the Day of Resurrection, when its fixed course will be abolished, it will come to a halt, and it will be rolled up.

instruction: What is the significance of the Ayah "And the moon, We have decreed for it stages" in the tafsir?
output: The Ayah means that Allah has caused the moon to run in a different orbit, from which passing of the months can be deduced, just as night and day are known from the sun. It also signifies that the moon passes through different phases, appearing small when it rises, then increasing in light as it passes through its phases until it becomes full, and then wanes until the end of the month.

instruction: What is one of the signs of Allah mentioned in the Quran?
output: One of the signs of Allah is that He has subjugated the sea to carry ships.

instruction: What is the significance of the ship of Nuh mentioned in the Quran?
output: The ship of Nuh is significant as it was filled with luggage and animals, and Allah saved Nuh and the believers in it, sparing them from being among the descendants of Adam left on the face of the earth.

instruction: What does the Quranic verse "And We have created for them of the like thereunto, on which they ride" refer to?
output: This verse refers to the ships created after the ship of Nuh, which were similar to it.

instruction: What is the reference of "that which is before you, and that which is behind you"?
output: It refers to sins.

instruction: What does the phrase "so that, if you fear such things Allah will have mercy on you and will save you from His punishment" imply?
output: It implies that they would be saved from His punishment if they fear such things.

instruction: What does the phrase "but they did not accept it or benefit from it" refer to?
output: It refers to the Ayat of their Lord (signs of Tawhid and the truth of the Messengers).

instruction: What did the disbelievers think about the Day of Resurrection?
output: The disbelievers thought that the Day of Resurrection would never come to pass.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "They await only but a single Sayhah which will seize them while they are disputing!"?
output: The phrase signifies that the disbelievers are only waiting for a single shout which will be the trumpet blast of terror, causing them to die instantly while they are in their marketplaces and places of work, arguing and disputing.

instruction: What will happen to the people who are alive after the first trumpet blast in the Day of Resurrection?
output: After the first trumpet blast, the people who are alive will be driven to the gathering place by a fire which will surround them on all sides. They will not be able to make bequest regarding their possessions or return to their family. Then after that, the trumpet blast of the resurrection will be sounded.

instruction: What is the third trumpet blast that will occur on the Day of Resurrection?
output: The third trumpet blast is the Trumpet Blast of the Resurrection, when people will come forth from their graves.

instruction: What does the term Yansilun mean in the context of the Day of Resurrection?
output: Yansilun means they will be walking quickly, like the Ayah "The Day when they will come out of the graves quickly as racing to a goal."

instruction: What do the disbelievers say when they are resurrected, and what does it indicate?
output: The disbelievers will say, "Woe to us! Who has raised us up from our place of sleep," indicating their surprise and disbelief at their resurrection.

instruction: What will the people of Paradise be too busy with on the Day of Resurrection?
output: The people of Paradise will be too busy with their own victory and eternal delights to worry about anyone else.

instruction: What does the phrase "Their spouses, will be in pleasant shade" mean?
output: Their spouses will be in the shade of trees in Paradise.

instruction: What do the people of Paradise have in Paradise?
output: The people of Paradise have therein fruits of all kinds and whatever they ask for, all kinds and types.

instruction: What does Allah command the angels to do on the Day of Judgment?
output: On the Day of Judgment, the angels are commanded to gather those who did wrong, along with their partners (in disbelief) and lead them on the way to the flaming fire (Hell).

instruction: Who is the 'plain enemy' that the Children of Adam obeyed instead of Allah?
output: The 'plain enemy' that the Children of Adam obeyed instead of Allah is the Shaytan.

instruction: What is the rebuke that Allah addresses to the disbelievers among the sons of Adam?
output: Allah rebukes the disbelievers among the sons of Adam for obeying the Shaytan, their plain enemy, instead of worshiping Allah, despite His command to them to do otherwise.

instruction: What is the significance of the statement "this is Hell which you were promised!" in the Islamic tafsir?
output: The statement "this is Hell which you were promised!" means that this is what the Messengers warned the disbelievers about, and they did not believe them.

instruction: What will happen to the disbelievers and hypocrites on the Day of Resurrection according to the tafsir?
output: On the Day of Resurrection, the disbelievers and hypocrites will deny the sins they committed in this world and swear that they did not do that. Allah will seal their mouths and cause their limbs to speak about what they did.

instruction: What will happen to the believer on the Day of Resurrection, according to the tafsir?
output: The believer will be called to account on the Day of Resurrection, and his Lord will show him his deeds, just between him and His Lord. He will admit it and will say, "Yes, O Lord, I did do that." Then Allah will forgive him his sins and conceal them, and no creature on earth will see any of those sins, but his good deeds will be seen, and he will want all the people to see them.

instruction: What does Allah teach through the creation of human beings?
output: Allah teaches us that this world is transient and will come to an end; it is not eternal and lasting.

instruction: What does the Qur'an represent according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The Qur'an is a Reminder and a plain Qur'an, clear and self-explanatory to the one who ponders and comprehends its meanings.

instruction: Why was the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ forbidden to compose poetry?
output: The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ was forbidden to compose poetry because Allah taught him the Qur'an, which is not poetry, and he did not know how to compose it, he did not like it, and he had no natural inclination towards it.

instruction: What does the phrase "so that they are their owners" imply according to Qatadah?
output: It implies that the cattle are their masters.

instruction: What does the statement "So they are submissive towards them and do not resist them" signify?
output: It signifies that even a young child can control a large herd of cattle.

instruction: What are some of the benefits humans derive from cattle according to the tafsir?
output: Some of the benefits include riding them, eating them, using their wool, fur, and hair for various articles, drinking their milk, and using their urine as medicine.

instruction: What does Allah denounce the idolators for?
output: Allah denounces the idolators for taking idols as gods alongside Allah, hoping that those gods will help them and provide for them and bring them closer to Allah.

instruction: What does Allah's saying "They cannot help them" mean?
output: Allah's saying "They cannot help them" means that those gods cannot help their worshippers; they are too weak, too insignificant, and too powerless.

instruction: What does Allah's saying "but they will be brought forward as a troop" mean according to Mujahid's view?
output: According to Mujahid's view, Allah's saying "but they will be brought forward as a troop" means that those idols will be gathered together and will be present when their worshippers are brought to account, as this will add to their grief and will be more effective in establishing proof against them.

instruction: What does the Hadith of the gravedigger illustrate?
output: The Hadith of the gravedigger illustrates the story of a man who, when he was about to die, commanded his family to burn his body, grind his remains into small pieces, and scatter them in the sea. After they did that, Allah resurrected him and asked him why he had done that, to which he replied, "The fear of You, and You know best." Allah then forgave him.

instruction: What is the generic meaning of the definite article "Al" in the verse "Does not man see that We have created him from Nutfah"?
output: The generic meaning of the definite article "Al" in the verse "Does not man see that We have created him from Nutfah" is that it applies to all those who deny the Resurrection.

instruction: What does the Ayah "We have created him from Nutfah. Yet behold he (stands forth) as an open opponent" mean?
output: The Ayah "We have created him from Nutfah. Yet behold he (stands forth) as an open opponent" means that the one who is denying the resurrection, cannot see that the One Who initiated creation can re-create it, as Allah initiated the creation of man from semen of despised fluid.

instruction: What does the Qur'an state about the creation of mankind compared to the creation of the heavens and the earth?
output: The creation of the heavens and the earth is greater than the creation of mankind (40:57).

instruction: What does Allah say about His power to re-create mankind?
output: Allah says that He is able to re-create mankind as He created them in the first place (52:49).

instruction: What does the Hadith of Abu Dharr (RA) reveal about Allah's command and creation?
output: The Hadith of Abu Dharr (RA) reveals that when Allah wants a thing to happen, He only needs to command it once; it does not need to be repeated or confirmed (Hadith of Abu Dharr, Ahmad).

instruction: Who were the angels mentioned in Surat As-Saffat and what are their roles?
output: The angels mentioned in Surat As-Saffat are those who form ranks in the heavens, drive the clouds in a good way, and bring the Dhikr (remembrance of Allah) to mankind.

instruction: What are the three favors that Muslims have been given over non-Muslims, according to a hadith narrated by Hudhayfah?
output: Muslims have been favored over non-Muslims by having their ranks made like the ranks of the angels, the entire earth being made a Masjid (mosque) for them, and the soil becoming a means of purification for them if they cannot find water.

instruction: What does the Ayah "By those who drive the clouds in a good way" in Surat As-Saffat mean according to As-Suddi?
output: The Ayah "By those who drive the clouds in a good way" in Surat As-Saffat means that the angels drive the clouds.

instruction: What does Allah do to protect the lowest heaven?
output: Allah adorns the lowest heaven with the heavenly bodies and guards it from every rebellious Shaytan.

instruction: What happens when a Shayatin tries to eavesdrop on the heavenly group?
output: A piercing fire comes and burns him.

instruction: What is the punishment for Shayatin in the Hereafter?
output: They will have an ongoing, everlasting and painful torment.

instruction: What did Allah challenge the disbelievers about the resurrection according to the tafsir?
output: Allah challenged the disbelievers about which is harder to create: the heavens, the earth, the angels, devils, mighty creatures, or the resurrection of humans.

instruction: What did Ibn Mas`ud say about the disbelievers' response to Allah's challenge?
output: Ibn Mas`ud said that they admitted that these things were harder to create than themselves, but they still denied the resurrection.

instruction: What did Allah say about the creation of humans according to the tafsir?
output: Allah said that humans were created from something weak, like sticky mud, which is useful. This was used to emphasize the transformation of humans from dust and bones to re-creation on the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: What will the disbelievers say on the Day of Resurrection?
output: On the Day of Resurrection, the disbelievers will say, "Woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense!"

instruction: What does the phrase "their companions" mean in the verse "Assemble those who did wrong, together with their companions"?
output: "Their companions" means "Their counterparts, those who are like them."

instruction: What does the phrase "what they used to worship" refer to in the Quranic verse?
output: "What they used to worship" refers to their idols and false gods.

instruction: What do the disbelievers argue about on the Day of Resurrection?
output: The disbelievers argue about who led the other into misguidance in the worldly life.

instruction: What do the arrogant disbelievers say to the weak disbelievers on the Day of Resurrection?
output: The arrogant disbelievers say to the weak disbelievers, "the Word of Allah has been justified against us, that we are among the doomed who will taste the punishment of the Day of Resurrection."

instruction: What does the verse "Fa'innaheum yawma'idhin fi al-'Adhabi mush'tariquna" (So now the Word of our Lord has been justified against us, that we shall certainly (have to) taste (the torment)) mean?
output: This verse means that on the Day of Resurrection, the arrogant disbelievers will admit that the Word of Allah has been justified against them, and they will taste the torment (punishment) they deserve.

instruction: What is the main idea of the Islamic tafsir you provided?
output: The main idea of the Islamic tafsir is the description of the rewards for the sincere believers in Paradise, contrasted with the punishment for the idolaters in Hell.

instruction: What does the verse "إِلاَّ عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ" mean in this context?
output: In this context, "إِلاَّ عِبَادَ اللَّهِ الْمُخْلَصِينَ" means the chosen servants of Allah. These are the believers who will not taste the painful torment nor be brought to account in the Hereafter. Their evil acts, if there are any, will be overlooked, and each good deed will be rewarded in multiples.

instruction: How is the wine of Paradise described in the tafsir?
output: The wine of Paradise is described as a cup of pure, white, and delicious wine that will not cause any negative effects, such as headaches, stomach aches, intoxication, or any other repulsive characteristics found in the wine of this world.

instruction: What is the conversation between the people of Paradise like, and what are they discussing?
output: The conversation between the people of Paradise is about their past lives, asking each other about their situations, how they were in this world, and what they suffered. This is part of their conversation when they get together to converse and drink, sitting on their thrones, servants coming and going, bringing all kinds of good food, drink, clothes, and other delights no eye has seen, no ear has heard, never having comprehended the mind of man.

instruction: What does the speaker refer to when he says, "That when we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed be indebted (Madinun)"?
output: This refers to an idolator man who had a companion among the believers in this world. He used to say those words by way of astonishment, disbelief, and stubbornness.

instruction: What does the phrase "So he looked down and saw him in the midst of the Fire" mean?
output: This means, in the middle of Hell. Ibn `Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him, Sa`id bin Jubayr, Khulayd Al-`Usari, Qatadah, As-Suddi, and `Ata' Al-Khurasani said, "This means, in the middle of Hell as if he were a burning star."

instruction: What is the Tree of Zaqqum and why is it mentioned in the Quran?
output: The Tree of Zaqqum is a tree that grows in Hell, mentioned in the Quran as a trial for the wrongdoers, to test their faith and belief. It is a tree that springs out from the bottom of Hell-fire.

instruction: What does the phrase "The shoots of its fruit stalks are like the heads of Shayatin" mean?
output: The phrase means that the Tree of Zaqqum is extremely ugly, repulsive, and compared to the heads of Shayatin (devils), even though they have never seen them, because it is a well-established idea in people's minds that devils are ugly in appearance.

instruction: What happens to the people of Hell when they eat from the Zaqqum tree?
output: When they eat from the Zaqqum tree, their skin will fall off, their flesh will melt, they will walk with their guts falling out, their faces will be baked by the heat of the water they drink, and they will be beaten with hooked rods of iron. Then every part of their bodies will burst into loud lamentations.

instruction: What does the phrase "the end of those who were warned" refer to in the given tafsir?
output: The end of those who were warned refers to the final destination or fate of individuals who were given guidance but disregarded it.

instruction: Who are the "chosen servants of Allah" mentioned in the tafsir?
output: The "chosen servants of Allah" are individuals who accepted the guidance and followed the path of righteousness.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "except the chosen servants of Allah" in the given tafsir?
output: The phrase "except the chosen servants of Allah" signifies that not all those who were warned faced the same fate; the righteous ones (the chosen servants of Allah) were exempted from the same.

instruction: Who was Nuh, and why was he sent as a Prophet?
output: Nuh was a Prophet sent by Allah to guide his people, but they rejected him. He was sent to preach the message of monotheism, and he stayed among his people for a long time, for one thousand years less fifty, but his people did not believe him.

instruction: Who were the survivors after the destruction of Nuh's people?
output: The survivors after the destruction of Nuh's people were his offspring. According to the narration of Ibn 'Abbas, there was no one left apart from the offspring of Nuh, peace be upon him.

instruction: Who were the descendants of Nuh's offspring, according to the Prophet's saying?
output: The descendants of Nuh's offspring are Sam, who was the father of the Arabs, Ham, who was the father of the Ethiopians, and Yafith, who was the father of the Romans, as stated by the Prophet, peace be upon him.

instruction: Who was Ibrahim among those who followed his ways?
output: Ibrahim was among those who followed his religion.

instruction: What does the term "Salim heart" refer to in the story of Ibrahim?
output: The term "Salim heart" refers to one who bears witness that none has the right to be worshipped except Allah.

instruction: What did Ibrahim denounce his people for?
output: Ibrahim denounced his people for their worship of idols and false gods.

instruction: What did Qatadah mean when he said, "The Arabs say of one who thinks deeply that he is looking at the stars"?
output: Qatadah meant that Ibrahim looked at the heavens thinking of a way to distract his people.

instruction: What did Ibrahim (peace and blessings be upon him) not lie except in three cases?
output: The three cases were for the sake of Allah: when he said, "Verily, I am sick"; when he said, "Nay, this one, the biggest (his wife) of them (idols) did it"; and when he said concerning (his wife) Sarah, "She is my sister."

instruction: What did Ibrahim do to his people's idols after they left their gathering?
output: Ibrahim turned to their gods and broke them after they had left.

instruction: Who was the son of Ibrahim (Abraham) that Allah commanded to be sacrificed?
output: Isma`il (Ishmael) was the son of Ibrahim (Abraham) that Allah commanded to be sacrificed.

instruction: What was the special status of Isma`il (Ishmael) among Ibrahim's (Abraham's) children?
output: Isma`il was the first child of whom glad tidings were given to Ibrahim, peace be upon him, and he was older than Ishaq.

instruction: What was the purpose of Allah's command to Ibrahim (Abraham) to sacrifice his son?
output: The purpose of Allah's command was primarily to reward Ibrahim for his patience and resolve in sacrificing his son, and to test his obedience to Allah.

instruction: Who were Musa and Harun in Islamic history?
output: Musa and Harun were two of the most important prophets in Islamic history, sent by Allah to guide their people.

instruction: What did Allah give to Musa and Harun?
output: Allah gave Musa and Harun the criterion (of right and wrong), a shining light, and the clear Scripture, called the Tawrah.

instruction: How did Allah reward Musa and Harun?
output: Allah rewarded Musa and Harun with peace in this world and eternal rewards in the Hereafter, as they were two of Allah's believing servants.

instruction: What does the phrase "Ba'l" in the Quranic verse mean according to Ibn 'Abbas, Mujahid, 'Ikrimah, Qatadah, and As-Suddi?
output: The word Ba'l means 'lord'.

instruction: What does the phrase "Will you call upon Ba'l and forsake the Best of creators, Allah" mean in context?
output: This means, "Will you worship an idol, and forsake the One who is worthy of your worship alone, with no partners or associates?"

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "Save the chosen servants of Allah" in the Quranic verse?
output: This refers to those who believe in Allah alone.

instruction: Who was Allah's Messenger sent to in the story of the people of Lut?
output: Allah's Messenger was sent to Lut (Lot) peace be upon him.

instruction: What happened to Lut's wife when he was saved from his people?
output: His wife was destroyed along with her people.

instruction: Where is the foul, stinking lake mentioned in the story located?
output: The foul, stinking lake mentioned in the story is located on a well-travelled route between Arabia and Syria, close to the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah, known as the Dead Sea.

instruction: Who was Yunus (prophet Jonah) and what was his story?
output: Yunus is the prophet Jonah, peace be upon him. His story is narrated in Surat Al-Anbiya' (21:87-88) where he was sent to a people but when they did not believe in him, he ran to a laden ship. When the ship was in danger, they drew lots and he was among the losers, about to be thrown overboard, but he threw himself into the sea and was swallowed by a fish. He spent time in the fish's belly, praying, and eventually was rescued by Allah.

instruction: According to the Hadith, how long did Yunus spend in the belly of the fish?
output: The scholars differed as to how long Yunus spent in the belly of the fish. Some said three days, some said seven days, some said forty days, and Mujahid said it swallowed him in the morning and cast him forth in the evening. The exact duration is not known.

instruction: What was the significance of Yunus's story in terms of his faith and the faith of his people?
output: Yunus's story emphasizes the importance of continuously remembering and worshiping Allah during times of ease, as well as hardship. His faith and righteous deeds during his time of ease played a role in his rescue and salvation. In contrast, the people he was sent to did not believe in him, and Allah's punishment was not lifted from them.

instruction: Who did the idolators attribute daughters to, and what did they attribute to themselves?
output: The idolators attributed daughters to Allah, and they attributed to themselves what they desired, which was male offspring.

instruction: What does the ayah "Then how can they attribute to Allah the share that they would not choose for themselves" refer to?
output: The ayah "Then how can they attribute to Allah the share that they would not choose for themselves" refers to the idolators' desire for male offspring for themselves, while attributing female offspring to Allah.

instruction: What does the phrase "Or did We create the angels female while they were witnesses" imply in this tafsir?
output: The phrase "Or did We create the angels female while they were witnesses" implies that the idolators' claim that the angels are female is false, as they did not witness their creation.

instruction: What does Allah say in the Quran about the idolators and their followers?
output: Allah says that only those who are more misguided than the idolators will believe their false beliefs and follow their misguided ways of false worship.

instruction: What does Allah say about the angels and their ranks according to the Quran?
output: Allah says that each angel has a known place or position, and that they stand in rows to worship Him.

instruction: What did the people of Quraysh wish for?
output: The people of Quraysh wished that they would have a reminder like the people of old, so they could have been guided by it.

instruction: What does the verse "And, verily, Our Word has gone forth of old for Our servants, the Messengers," indicate according to the tafsir?
output: The verse indicates that the Messengers and their followers will ultimately prevail in this world and the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the meaning of "So turn away from them for a while," in the tafsir?
output: "So turn away from them for a while" means to bear their annoyance with patience and wait until an appointed time when Allah will cause the Messengers and their followers to prevail.

instruction: What does the verse "Do they seek to hasten on Our torment" mean in the context of the tafsir?
output: "Do they seek to hasten on Our torment" means that the disbelievers seek to hasten on the punishment because they disbelieve in the Messenger and Allah is angry with them because of that.

instruction: What does the phrase "Subhanarabbi rabbil 'izzi" mean in the context of the Islamic tafsir?
output: "Subhanarabbi rabbil 'izzi" means "Glorified be your Lord, the Lord of Al-'Izzah!" It refers to the Owner of might and power Whom none can resist.

instruction: What does the phrase "wa salamun 'ala al-mursalina" mean in the Islamic tafsir?
output: "Wa salamun 'ala al-mursalina" means "And Salam (peace!) be on the Messengers!" This phrase is a request for Allah's peace upon the prophets in both this world and the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "wa al-hamdu lillahi rabbil 'alameen" in the Islamic tafsir?
output: "Wa al-hamdu lillahi rabbil 'alameen" means "And all the praises and thanks be to Allah, Lord of all that exists." This phrase signifies that all praise and thanks are due to Allah, the Lord of all that exists.

instruction: What does the phrase "By the Qur'an full of reminding" mean in the Islamic tafsir?
output: The phrase "By the Qur'an full of reminding" means that the Qur'an includes all that is in it as a reminder and a benefit to people in this life and the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the reason for the oath mentioned in the Islamic tafsir?
output: The reason for the oath is to emphasize the disbelief of the people who denied the Messengers and to warn them about the consequences of their actions, as they will be destroyed because of their opposition to the Messengers and their disbelief in the Scriptures that were revealed from heaven.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "How many a generation have We destroyed before them" in the Islamic tafsir?
output: The significance of the phrase "How many a generation have We destroyed before them" is to remind the disbelieving nations that their fate will be similar to the nations who came before them, if they continue to reject the Messengers and the Scriptures that were revealed from heaven.

instruction: What were the idolaters amazed at regarding the message of Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him)?
output: The idolaters were amazed at the Message, Tawhid and the Qur'an sent to Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) as a bringer of glad tidings and a warner.

instruction: What did the idolaters say about the Tawhid to which Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) calls them?
output: The idolaters said, "This is nothing but an invention! A lie! A fabrication!"

instruction: What is the meaning of the statement, "Has the Reminder been sent down to him (alone) from among us"?
output: The statement means that it was unlikely that Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him) would be singled out from among them to receive the Qur'an.

instruction: Who were the Confederates mentioned in the verse "Ul-aeeka al-Ahzaabu"?
output: The Confederates were past nations who were stronger and wealthier than the people addressed in the Qur'an, but their disbelief in the Messengers led to their destruction despite their strength and wealth.

instruction: What does the term "Sayhah" refer to in the verse "Wa ma yanzeeru huulaa' ila Sayhahah"?
output: "Sayhah" refers to the blast on the Trumpet when Allah will command Israfil to sound a long note, causing terror to everyone in the heaven and on earth except those whom Allah spares.

instruction: What do the idolators mean when they say "Our Lord! Hasten to us Qittana before the Day of Reckoning"?
output: When the idolators say "Our Lord! Hasten to us Qittana before the Day of Reckoning," they are asking for punishment to be hastened upon themselves, either meaning they want their allotted share or fortune to come quickly, or they are mockingly asking for whatever they deserve, good or bad, to be hastened for them in this world.

instruction: What does the term "Al-Ayd" mean in relation to Dawud (Daud), peace be upon him, in Islamic tradition?
output: Al-Ayd means strength, specifically strength in knowledge and action.

instruction: What was the significance of Dawud's (Daud's) prayer routine and fasting according to Islamic tradition?
output: Dawud, peace be upon him, used to spend a third of the night in prayer, and he fasted for half a lifetime. This was reported in the Two Sahihs, and it shows his deep devotion and dedication to Allah.

instruction: What does the Ayah "يَجِبَالُ أَوِّبِى مَعَهُ وَالطَّيْرَ" mean in the context of Dawud (Daud)?
output: The Ayah "O you mountains. Glorify (Allah) with him! And you birds (also)!" means that the mountains and birds used to glorify Allah's praises with Dawud. This shows the respect and reverence that even inanimate objects and animals had for Dawud.

instruction: What was the story of the two litigants in the Qur'an that scholars of Tafsir mention?
output: The story of the two litigants is a story mostly based on Isra'iliyat narrations. It is a story about two individuals who climbed the fence surrounding the Prophet David's private chamber to ask him about their case. However, it is not a story that has been reported authentically from the Prophet.

instruction: What does the prostration in Surah Sad signify according to the scholars of Tafsir?
output: The prostration in Surah Sad signifies an act of thanks (Sajdat Shukr). This is based on the report recorded by Imam Ahmad from Ibn `Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ also prostrated in this Surah.

instruction: What are the rewards for the righteous individuals on the Day of Resurrection according to Surah Sad?
output: On the Day of Resurrection, the righteous individuals will have good deeds by virtue of which they will be brought close to Allah and have a good place of (final) return, which means the lofty levels of Paradise, because of their repentance and their perfect justice in their kingdom. This is based on the verse "and verily, for him is a near access to Us, and a good place of (final) return." (Surah Sad, 34:37)

instruction: What is the purpose of the advice from Allah to those in positions of authority?
output: The advice is for rulers and leaders to rule according to the truth and justice revealed from Allah, and not to turn away from it or be led astray from the path of Allah.

instruction: What is the stern warning mentioned in the verse regarding those who go astray from Allah's path and forget the Day of Resurrection?
output: The warning is of a severe punishment for those who go astray from Allah's path and forget the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: According to the tafsir, what will happen to rulers who neglect their duties for the sake of the Day of Reckoning?
output: According to the tafsir, rulers who neglect their duties for the sake of the Day of Reckoning will have a severe punishment on the Day of Reckoning.

instruction: What is the purpose of Allah's creation of the universe?
output: Allah's creation of the universe was not in vain. It was to worship Him Alone, and He will gather the people on the Day of Gathering to reward the obedient and punish the disbelievers.

instruction: Why does Allah not treat the believers and disbelievers equally in this world?
output: Allah does not treat believers and disbelievers equally because of His justice and wisdom. There must inevitably be another realm in which those who obey Allah will be rewarded and the wicked will be punished.

instruction: What is the significance of the Qur'an being a 'Book which We have sent down to you, full of blessings, that they may ponder over its Ayat, and that men of understanding may remember'?
output: The Qur'an is a revelation sent to guide people with wisdom and reason. It is for people to ponder over its verses and for those with sound minds and upright nature to remember its teachings.

instruction: Who inherited prophethood from Prophet Dawud?
output: Prophet Sulayman, the son of Prophet Dawud, inherited prophethood from him.

instruction: What is praiseworthy about Prophet Sulayman mentioned in the text?
output: Prophet Sulayman was very much obedient, worshipped Allah much and always turned to Allah in repentance.

instruction: What did Prophet Sulayman see in the afternoon that was displayed before him?
output: He saw well-trained horses of the highest breed.

instruction: Who was Sulayman, peace be upon him, and what test did Allah put him through?
output: Sulayman, peace be upon him, was a Prophet and a king who was given great power, including control over the wind. Allah tested him by placing a body on his throne, and he responded by asking for forgiveness and a kingdom that would not belong to anyone after him.

instruction: What did the Prophet ﷺ say when he was bothered by an `Ifrit from among the Jinn during prayer?
output: The Prophet ﷺ said, "I seek refuge with Allah from you," and then "I curse you with the curse of Allah" three times. He also stretched out his hand as if he was reaching out to take something.

instruction: According to Al-Hasan Al-Basri, may Allah have mercy on him, what did Sulayman, peace be upon him, do that Allah compensated him with something better and swifter?
output: According to Al-Hasan Al-Basari, may Allah have mercy on him, when Sulayman, peace be upon him, slaughtered the horses out of anger for the sake of Allah, Allah compensated him with the wind whose morning was a month's (journey), and its afternoon was a month's (journey).

instruction: Who is Ayyub mentioned in the Ayah "And remember Our servant Ayyub, when he invoked his Lord (saying): "Verily, Shaytan has afflicted me with distress and torment!""?
output: Ayyub is the servant and Messenger of Allah who was tested with bodily afflictions and the loss of his wealth and children.

instruction: How did Ayyub's wife help him during his affliction?
output: Ayyub's wife worked for people as a paid servant, and she fed and served him for nearly eighteen years.

instruction: What did Ayyub pray for, and how was he healed?
output: Ayyub prayed to the Lord of the worlds, "Verily, distress has seized me, and You are the Most Merciful of all those who show mercy." Allah commanded him to stand up and strike the ground with his foot, and a spring of water flowed, which he was commanded to wash in and drink from, and all the pain and affliction in his body disappeared. Then He commanded him to strike the ground in a different place, and Allah caused another spring to flow, and Ayyub was commanded to drink from it, and all his internal problems disappeared, and he became healthy again, inside and out.

instruction: Who are the Ulil-Aydi wal-Absar?
output: Ulil-Aydi wal-Absar refers to the Prophets who had great strength and worship, and understanding of the religion.

instruction: What does the phrase "Verily, We did choose them by granting them the remembrance of the Abode" mean?
output: This phrase means that Allah chose these Prophets by granting them a strong desire for the Hereafter, and a focus on striving for it.

instruction: What is the meaning of "This is a Reminder"?
output: "This is a Reminder" refers to the Holy Qur'an, as interpreted by As-Suddi.

instruction: What is the ultimate destination of the blessed and believing servants in the Hereafter?
output: The ultimate destination of the blessed and believing servants in the Hereafter is the eternal gardens (Paradise).

instruction: What is the significance of the doors being opened for the believing servants in Paradise?
output: The doors being opened for the believing servants in Paradise symbolizes the ease and access they have to the gardens.

instruction: What do the women in Paradise refrain from?
output: The women in Paradise refrain from turning their glances to anyone except their husbands.

instruction: What is the title of the Islamic tafsir passage?
output: The Final Return of the Doomed

instruction: What does the phrase "And other of similar kind (opposite pairs)" in the tafsir passage mean?
output: This phrase refers to different kinds of punishments, such as intense cold and intense heat, drinking Hamim, eating the bitter tree of Az-Zaqqum, being lifted up and thrown down.

instruction: What will the people of Hell say to one another when a new group arrives in Hell?
output: When a new group arrives, the people of Hell will say, "This is a troop entering with you (in Hell), no welcome for them! Verily, they shall enter in the Fire!" and the new group will respond, "Nay, you (too)! No welcome for you! It is you who brought this upon us."

instruction: What does "I am a warner, I am not as you claim" mean in the given Islamic tafsir?
output: "I am a warner" refers to the Messenger's role as a warning to the disbelievers, and "I am not as you claim" means that the Messenger is not what they claim him to be, which is a liar or a madman.

instruction: What does "the Almighty, the Oft-Forgiving" mean in the given Islamic tafsir?
output: "The Almighty" refers to Allah's power and control over everything, and "the Oft-Forgiving" means that Allah is Oft-Forgiving as well as being All-Powerful.

instruction: What does the phrase "From which you turn away!" mean in the given Islamic tafsir?
output: "From which you turn away!" means that the disbelievers neglect or reject the great news of the Messenger's prophethood.

instruction: Who refused to prostrate to Adam, and why?
output: Iblis, also known as Satan or Shaitan, refused to prostrate to Adam because he disputed with Allah about him, claiming that he was better than Adam, as he was created from fire while Adam was created from clay.

instruction: What did Allah do to Iblis after he refused to prostrate to Adam?
output: Allah exiled him, humiliated him, and cast him out of His mercy and His sacred Presence, and called him "Iblis" symbolizing that he had Ablasa min Ar-Rahmah (despaired of mercy) -- that there was no hope for him of mercy. He cast him down from the heavens, disgraced and rejected, to the earth.

instruction: What did Iblis ask Allah for, when he knew that he was safe from destruction until the Day of Resurrection?
output: Iblis asked Allah for a reprieve until the Day of Resurrection, so the Forbearing One, Who does not hasten to punish those who disobey Him, gave him a reprieve. When he knew that he was safe from destruction until the Day of Resurrection, he rebelled and transgressed.

instruction: What does the phrase "nor am I one of the Mutakallifin" in the Quran mean?
output: It means that the prophet is not adding anything to what Allah has told him, and he does not take anything away. He is seeking the Face of Allah and the Hereafter.

instruction: What is the meaning of the Ayah "It is only a Reminder for all the creatures"?
output: This means that the Quran is a reminder for all those who are held accountable, men and Jinn.

instruction: What does the Ayah "And you shall certainly know the truth of it" mean?
output: It means that the people will see confirmation that what the prophet says is true.

instruction: What is the meaning of the phrase "The Virtues of Surat Az-Zumar"?
output: The Virtues of Surat Az-Zumar refers to the significant benefits and blessings in reciting Surah Az-Zumar, as reported by `A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, in the Hadith recorded by An-Nasa'i.

instruction: What does Allah tell us about the revelation of the Qur'an in Surah Az-Zumar?
output: Allah tells us that the revelation of the Qur'an in Surah Az-Zumar is from Him, the Almighty and the All-Wise, sent down by the trustworthy Ruh (Jibril) upon the heart of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ.

instruction: According to Surah Az-Zumar, what is the main objective of mankind's worship?
output: According to Surah Az-Zumar, the main objective of mankind's worship should be to worship Allah Alone with no partner or associate, and call mankind to this truth, as Allah forbids any form of shirk and the worship of anyone or anything except Him Alone.

instruction: What does Allah create from a single soul?
output: Allah created all humans, with their varied races, types, languages, and colors, from a single soul, which was Adam, peace be upon him.

instruction: What does Allah send down for humans from the cattle?
output: Allah has created for humans from among the cattle, eight pairs. These are the ones that are mentioned in Surat Al-An`am, eight kinds - a pair of sheep, a pair of goats, a pair of camels, and a pair of oxen.

instruction: What does Allah create a human in, and how does this creation progress?
output: Allah creates a human in the wombs of their mothers. The creation process involves the human initially as a Nutfah, then an `Alaqah, then a Mudghah, then he is created and becomes flesh, bones, nerves, and veins, and the Ruh (soul) is breathed into him. He then becomes another type of creation.

instruction: What does Allah hate?
output: Allah hates disbelief (kufr).

instruction: What does Allah like for his servants?
output: Allah likes gratitude (shukr) from his servants.

instruction: What does "No bearer of burdens shall bear the burden of another" mean?
output: It means that no person can bear anything for another; each person will be asked about his own affairs.

instruction: What does the term "Ana'a Al-Layl" refer to in Islamic context?
output: Ana'a Al-Layl means in the depths of the night, during which the obedient worshipper stands in prayer and prostrates in fear and hope of Allah.

instruction: What does the phrase "fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the mercy of his Lord" signify in Islamic worship?
output: In Islamic worship, this phrase signifies that while worshipping, the believer experiences both fear and hope. Fear is essential to express one's humility before Allah, while hope is the believer's expectation for Allah's mercy.

instruction: What is the significance of reciting one hundred Ayat in one night in Islamic context?
output: In Islamic context, it is considered that if one recites one hundred Ayat in one night, it will be recorded as if he prayed the entire night. This is known from the Hadith of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ.

instruction: What does the command "Have Taqwa of your Lord" mean according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The command "Have Taqwa of your Lord" means to remain steadfast in obedience to Allah and to have fear and respect for Him.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "So emigrate through it and strive hard and keep away from idols" according to the tafsir?
output: The phrase "So emigrate through it and strive hard and keep away from idols" in the tafsir signifies moving away from wrongdoing, working hard to do good deeds, and avoiding idol worship.

instruction: What does the phrase "Only those who are patient shall receive their reward in full, without reckoning" imply according to the tafsir?
output: The phrase "Only those who are patient shall receive their reward in full, without reckoning" implies that those who are patient in their faith will receive an immense reward without weighing or measuring, and this reward will be given in Paradise.

instruction: What does the verse "إِنِّى أَخَافُ إِنْ عَصَيْتُ رَبِّى عَذَابَ يَوْمٍ عَظِيمٍ" mean according to this tafsir?
output: This verse means that the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is afraid of the torment of a great Day (i.e., the Day of Resurrection) if he disobeys his Lord.

instruction: What does the verse "قُلْ إِنَّ الْخَـسِرِينَ" mean according to this tafsir?
output: This verse means that those who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection are the greatest losers of all. They will be separated and will never meet again, whether their families have gone to Paradise and they have gone to Hell, or all of them have gone to Hell, they will never meet or feel happiness again.

instruction: What does the verse "ذَلِكَ يُخَوِّفُ اللَّهُ بِهِ عِبَادَهُ" mean according to this tafsir?
output: This verse means that Allah frightens His servants with this (i.e., the description of the punishment in the Fire) to keep them away from unlawful things and sin.

instruction: What do the rooms in Paradise look like, according to the hadith narrated by Ali?
output: The rooms in Paradise are solidly-constructed, high, and adorned, with both the inside and outside being able to be seen.

instruction: Who are the inhabitants of these rooms in Paradise, according to a hadith narrated by Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri?
output: The inhabitants of these rooms in Paradise are the people who speak kindly, feed the hungry, and stand in prayer at night, while others are sleeping.

instruction: What do the people of Paradise do while in their rooms, as described in a hadith narrated by Abu Hurayrah?
output: The people of Paradise look towards each other in the raised places of Paradise, just as people look at the stars on the horizon of the east or west. This is a symbol of their superiority and difference in ranks.

instruction: What is the parable that Allah uses to describe the life of this world?
output: Allah uses the parable of water that comes down from the sky, which causes crops to grow, then they become dry and brittle.

instruction: How does Allah describe a person whose breast He has opened to Islam?
output: Allah describes a person whose breast He has opened to Islam as being in light from his Lord.

instruction: What is the meaning of the Ayah "So, woe to those whose hearts are hardened against remembrance of Allah!" in the context of the tafsir?
output: The meaning of the Ayah "So, woe to those whose hearts are hardened against remembrance of Allah!" in the context of the tafsir is that these people do not feel humility or fear, do not understand, and are in plain error.

instruction: What does the phrase "ذُوقُواْ مَا كُنتُمْ تَكْسِبُونَ" mean in the Islamic context?
output: In the Islamic context, "ذُوقُواْ مَا كُنتُمْ تَكْسِبُونَ" (Taste what you used to earn!) refers to the punishment that the disbelievers will experience on the Day of Resurrection for their actions during their life on Earth.

instruction: In which three Ayat (verses) does the Quran compare the disbelievers with those who walk prone on their faces and those who are cast into the Fire?
output: The three Ayat in which the Quran compares the disbelievers with those who walk prone on their faces and those who are cast into the Fire are: - أَفَمَن يَمْشِى مُكِبّاً عَلَى وَجْهِهِ أَهْدَى أَمَّن يَمْشِى سَوِيّاً عَلَى صِرَطٍ مُّسْتَقِيمٍ (Is he who walks prone on his face, more rightly guided, or he who walks upright on the straight way) (67:22) - یَوْمَ یُسْحَبُونَ فِی النَّارِ عَلَى وُجُوهِهِمْ ذُوقُواْ مَسَّ سَقَرَ (The Day they will be dragged on their faces into the Fire (it will be said to them): "Taste you the touch of Hell!") (54:48) - أَفَمَن يُلْقَى فِى النَّارِ خَيْرٌ أَم مَّن يَأْتِى ءَامِناً يَوْمَ الْقِيَـمَةِ(Is he who is cast into the Fire better or he who comes secure on the Day of Resurrection) (41:40)

instruction: What does the phrase "فَأَذَاقَهُمُ اللَّهُ الْخِزْىَ فِى الْحَيَوةِ الدُّنْيَا" mean in the context of the Islamic tafsir?
output: In the context of the Islamic tafsir, "فَأَذَاقَهُمُ اللَّهُ الْخِزْىَ فِى الْحَيَوةِ الدُّنْيَا" (So Allah made them to taste the disgrace in the present life) means that by means of the punishment and revenge which He sent down upon them, the disbelievers of the previous generations experienced disgrace in this world, as a result of their denial of the Messengers.

instruction: What does the phrase "We have explained things to mankind in it the Qur'an by setting forth examples and parables" mean?
output: This phrase means that Allah has explained the Qur'an to mankind using parables and examples to make the meaning clearer and easier to understand.

instruction: What does the phrase "An Arabic Qur'an, without any crookedness (therein)" mean?
output: This phrase means that the Qur'an is in a plain Arabic tongue, with no crookedness, deviation or confusion. It is clear, plain proof.

instruction: What is the purpose of the parable of a man belonging to many partners disputing with one another and a (slave) man belonging entirely to one master as described in the Qur'an?
output: This parable is a comparison between the idolator who worships other gods besides Allah, and the sincere believer who worships none besides Allah. The idolator and the sincere believer are not the same, just like the man belonging to many partners and the man belonging entirely to one master.

instruction: Who did more wrong according to Allah in the verse 39:32?
output: The one who utters a lie against Allah and denies the truth when it comes to him.

instruction: Who brought the truth in the verse 39:32 and who did those who believed in it refer to?
output: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ and the Muslims respectively.

instruction: What is the reward of the doers of good in the verse 39:32?
output: They will have all that they desire in Paradise. The verse also indicates that Allah will expiate from them the evil of what they did and give them the reward according to the best of what they used to do.

instruction: What does the verse "Verily, We have sent down to you the Book for mankind in truth" mean?
output: The verse means that the Qur'an has been sent down to the Prophet Muhammad (pbuh) for all creation, mankind and Jinn, so that he may warn them with it.

instruction: What happens to a person who accepts guidance, and what happens to a person who goes astray?
output: A person who accepts guidance is only benefited by it, while the consequences of going astray will return to him.

instruction: What is the meaning of "But you are only a warner. And Allah is a Trustee over all things"?
output: This means that the Prophet Muhammad (pbuh) is only a warner, and he is not responsible for guiding others. Allah is the one who controls all things. The Prophet's duty is only to convey the message, and on Allah is the reckoning.

instruction: What is the concept of intercession in Islam?
output: In Islam, intercession is only with Allah, and it is not granted to anyone without Allah's permission.

instruction: What is the role of idols and false gods in Islamic belief?
output: Idols and false gods are inanimate and have no minds, cannot think, hear, or see. They are much worse off than animals and cannot intercede with Allah.

instruction: What does the verse "His is the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth" mean?
output: This verse means that Allah is in control of all that, and He is the One Who is in control of the heavens and the earth.

instruction: What does the phrase "You will judge between Your servants about that wherein they used to differ" mean?
output: It means that Allah will judge between His servants about their disputes in this world and on the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "Guide me with regard to that wherein there is dispute concerning the truth by Your leave"?
output: This phrase is a supplication by the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ, asking Allah to guide him to the truth when there is a dispute among people.

instruction: What does the phrase "Ransom will not be accepted from them, even if it were to be an earth-full of gold" mean?
output: This phrase means that no amount of wealth or possessions, not even an earth-full of gold, will be enough to ransom the idolators from the punishment they will receive on the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: What is the main message of Ayah 39:53, according to the Islamic tafsir?
output: The main message of Ayah 39:53 is a call to repentance for all sinners, regardless of their faith, and an assurance that Allah will forgive all sins if one repents and turns back to Him.

instruction: According to the tafsir, what is the significance of the phrase "Say: 'O My servants who have transgressed against themselves! Despair not of the mercy of Allah'"?
output: The phrase signifies that Allah invites all His creatures to His forgiveness, even those who commit grave sins such as Shirk, and that no one should despair of Allah's mercy, as He forgives all sins.

instruction: What is the meaning of the phrase "And whosoever has Taqwa of Allah, He will make a way for him to get out (from every difficulty)" in the tafsir?
output: The phrase "And whosoever has Taqwa of Allah, He will make a way for him to get out (from every difficulty)" means that anyone who has fear and reverence for Allah, He will make a way for them to escape from any difficulty or hardship they may face.

instruction: What happens to those who lied against Allah on the Day of Resurrection according to Islamic tafsir?
output: Those who lied against Allah on the Day of Resurrection will have their faces blackened.

instruction: Who will have whitened faces on the Day of Resurrection according to Islamic tafsir?
output: Those who follow Ahlus-Sunnah wal-Jama`ah will have whitened faces on the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: What is the meaning of "Evil shall touch them not" in the context of Islamic tafsir?
output: "Evil shall touch them not" means that on the Day of Resurrection, those who have Taqwa will not experience any evil or suffering.

instruction: Who is the Creator, Lord, Sovereign, and Controller of all things according to Islamic belief?
output: Allah is the Creator, Lord, Sovereign, and Controller of all things.

instruction: What is the literal meaning of "Maqalid" in the ayah "To Him belong the Maqalid of the heavens and the earth"?
output: "Maqalid" means "keys" in Persian.

instruction: What happens if one associates others in worship with Allah according to the ayah "If you join others in worship with Allah, surely your deeds will be in vain, and you will certainly be among the losers"?
output: If one associates others in worship with Allah, their deeds will be in vain, and they will certainly be among the losers.

instruction: What does the phrase "They made not a just estimate of Allah such as is due to Him" mean?
output: The idolators did not give Allah His due when they worshipped others alongside Him.

instruction: What does the Ayah "And on the Day of Resurrection the whole of the earth will be grasped by His Hand" imply?
output: The Ayah implies that on the Day of Resurrection, Allah will grasp the earth with one finger.

instruction: What did the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ say on the Minbar one day as quoted by Ibn `Umar, may Allah be pleased with him?
output: The Prophet Muhammad ﷺ said, "And the Lord will glorify Himself, saying "I am Compeller, I am the Proud, I am the King, I am the Mighty, I am the Most Generous."

instruction: What is the effect of the second trumpet-blast in the Islamic understanding of the Day of Judgement?
output: The second trumpet-blast will cause everyone who is alive in the heavens and on earth to die, except for him whom Allah wills.

instruction: Who will be the first to be brought back to life after the third trumpet-blast?
output: The first one to be brought back to life after the third trumpet-blast will be Israfil.

instruction: Describe the state of the people on the Day of Resurrection after the first blast.
output: After the first blast, people will be bones and dust. However, they will come alive again and witness the terrors of the Day of Resurrection, looking on in fear.

instruction: How does Allah describe the punishment of disbelievers in Hell?
output: Allah describes the punishment of disbelievers in Hell as a forced and thirsty journey, where they will be blind, dumb, and deaf, walking on their faces. The gates of Hell will be opened to them, and they will confess their sins.

instruction: What is the significance of the Messengers in the Day of Judgement according to the tafsir?
output: The Messengers are significant on the Day of Judgement, as they came to the disbelievers as a warning and established proof against them. Their rejection of them will be used as evidence against them on the Day of Judgement.

instruction: What is the fate of the disbelievers according to the tafsir?
output: The fate of the disbelievers, according to the tafsir, is that they will be forced to enter the gates of Hell to abide therein forever. This is due to their arrogance in this world and their refusal to follow the truth. The entire universe will bear witness that they deserve what they are suffering.

instruction: What does the phrase "And they will be judged" signify in the given tafsir?
output: All of creation.

instruction: What is the meaning of the phrase "with truth" in the given tafsir?
output: It refers to the judgement of all creation.

instruction: What does the phrase "And it will be said, 'All the praises and thanks be to Allah, the Lord of all that exists'" signify in the given tafsir?
output: It refers to all of creation, animate or inanimate, speaking words of praise to Allah, the Lord of all that exists.

instruction: What is the essence of the Qur'an according to Ibn `Abbas?
output: The essence of the Qur'an is the family of Ha Mim.

instruction: What is the parable of the Qur'an in relation to beautiful gardens, according to Humayd bin Zanjuyah and narrated by Al-Baghawi?
output: The first place (the Qur'an) is like the Qur'an, and the beautiful gardens are like the splendor of the family of Ha Mim in relation to the rest of the Qur'an.

instruction: What does the attribute "Swift at reckoning" mean in the context of the Qur'an?
output: It refers to Allah's swiftness in accounting for every deed, and in rewarding or punishing individuals according to their deeds.

instruction: What is the attribute of the disbelievers mentioned in the Islamic tafsir?
output: The attribute of the disbelievers mentioned in the tafsir is that they dispute the Ayat (signs) of Allah.

instruction: What does Allah tell us about the disbelievers who reject His signs after clear proof has come?
output: Allah tells us that no one rejects or disputes His signs after clear proof has come, but those who disbelieve.

instruction: What does Allah console His Prophet Muhammad ﷺ about in the tafsir?
output: Allah consoles His Prophet Muhammad ﷺ by reminding him that he has an example in the Prophets who came before him, for their nations disbelieved them and opposed them, and only a few believed in them.

instruction: Who are the angels that glorify and praise Allah?
output: The angels who are close to Allah, the bearers of the Throne, and the angels who are around Him glorify and praise Allah.

instruction: What does Allah command the angels to pray for the believers?
output: Allah commands that His angels who are close to Him should pray for the forgiveness of those who believe in the Unseen.

instruction: What do the angels say when a believer prays for his brother in his absence?
output: When a believer prays for his brother in his absence, the angel says, "Amin, and may you have something similar to it."

instruction: What does the Ayah "Indeed, Allah's aversion was greater towards you than your aversion toward yourselves, when you were called to the Faith but you used to refuse." (3:91) mean?
output: This Ayah means that Allah's hatred towards the people of misguidance when Faith is offered to them in this world, and they turn away from it and refuse to accept it, is greater than their hatred for themselves when they see the punishment of Allah with their own eyes on the Day of Resurrection.

instruction: What do the disbelievers ask for when they enter Hell and what is Allah's response?
output: When they enter Hell, the disbelievers will ask to go back to the world, but they will get no response from Allah.

instruction: What is the meaning of the phrase "Our Lord! You have made us to die twice, and You have given us life twice!" in the Quran?
output: This phrase means, `by Your almighty power, You have brought us to life after we were dead, then You caused us to die after we were alive; You are able to do whatever You will. We confess our sins and admit that we wronged ourselves in the world.'

instruction: What does Allah warn His servants about in the Ayat "يُنَزِّلُ الْمَلَـئِكَةَ بِالْرُّوحِ مِنْ أَمْرِهِ عَلَى مَن يَشَآءُ مِنْ عِبَادِهِ أَنْ أَنْذِرُواْ أَنَّهُ لاَ إِلَـهَ إِلاَ أَنَاْ فَاتَّقُونِ"?
output: Allah warns His servants that none has the right to be worshipped but Him and they must have Taqwa (fear and obedience) of Him.

instruction: What is the Day of Mutual Meeting mentioned in the tafsir?
output: The Day of Mutual Meeting is one of the names of the Day of Resurrection, of which Allah warns His servants. It is the Day when everyone will find out about his deeds, good and bad.

instruction: What does Allah do on the Day of Resurrection according to the tafsir?
output: On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will bring all His creation to account, and He does not do even a speck of dust's weight of injustice, whether it be for good or for evil. For every good deed He gives a tenfold reward and for every bad deed He gives recompense of one bad deed.

instruction: What is the name of the Day of Judgement, as mentioned in the Hadith?
output: The name of the Day of Judgement is "The Day that is drawing near".

instruction: What is the meaning of the phrase "When the hearts will be at the throats because of fear, and they will neither come out nor go back to their places"?
output: This phrase means that when the Day of Judgement approaches, people's hearts will be so fearful that they will be frozen, neither able to speak nor move.

instruction: What is the significance of the phrase "Allah knows the fraud of the eyes, and all that the breasts conceal"?
output: This phrase signifies that Allah is aware of every secret thought, every hidden intention, and every deception, even when the eyes and hearts seem innocent.

instruction: What does the phrase "فِى الاٌّرْضِ فَيَنظُرُواْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـقِبَةُ الَّذِينَ كَانُواْ مِن قَبْلِهِمْ" mean in the context of the Islamic tafsir?
output: This phrase means that the nations of the past who disbelieved in their Prophets (peace be upon them) for which the punishment came upon them even though they were stronger than Quraysh.

instruction: What do the traces in the land mentioned in the Islamic tafsir refer to?
output: The traces in the land mentioned in the Islamic tafsir refer to structures, buildings, and dwellings left behind by the nations of the past who disbelieved in their Prophets.

instruction: What was the reason why Allah punished the nations of the past mentioned in the Islamic tafsir?
output: The reason why Allah punished the nations of the past mentioned in the Islamic tafsir was because they came to them with clear signs and evidence, but they disbelieved and rejected the Message.

instruction: Who was Musa sent to by Allah?
output: Musa was sent to Fir`awn, the king of the Copts of Egypt.

instruction: What did Fir`awn and his people call Musa?
output: Fir`awn and his people called Musa "A sorcerer, liar."
